Este año está pensando cultivar 14,000 metros cuadrados de terreno y también sembrar frijol para el sustento de los hijos, porque para él estar sin enfermedades y tener la alimentación segura es una bendición que Dios le daría para el próximo año. A la vez le sirve como un activo, porque comenta que en un apuro, vende maíz y ya tiene dinero. 

La distancia al trabajo está cerca de donde vive a 10 minutos de camino por eso es que hace las dos actividades.  

El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para pagar el alquiler de la tierra $ 150 y 8 sacos de abono que está costando un promedio de $50 dólares y  el resto pagara unos 6 ayudantes para la siembra, también cancelara un crédito pendiente.

El cliente, tiene  sueños demasiados grande comenta, y a la vez tiene miedo que no se realicen; porque desea que los niños sean profesionales a un futuro y también, construir la casa porque la que tiene es de bahareque y así ofrecerle una vida mejor a la familia. Comenta que para esto trabajara de sol a sol y así poder alcanzarlo esperando en Dios y la bondad que muestran los de Kiva.
texts.en:
Guillermo is 35 years old. He went to school in his community up to the sixth grade. He has been married for 7 years and so far has 3 children, two boys and a girl. His life's companion takes care of the home, cares for the children, and in the afternoon sells nuegados and enchiladas. These are little dishes that the area residents like. 

He has a stable job. For the last four years he has worked doing maintenance at an Evangelical church. He is also a farmer and works at that starting from 2 in the afternoon. He has 20 years' experience.  This year, he is planning on planting 14,000 square meters of land and he will also plant beans to feed his children. For him being illness free and having secure food would be blessing from God for next year. He also says that this serves as an asset, because if he ever runs into trouble he can sell corn and he'll have the money.  

The distance to his job is about 10 minutes away and that is why he has two jobs. 

The loan he is asking for from CREDICAMPO is to pay for renting the land, $150 and for 8 sacks of fertilizer, at an average of $50, and the rest will be used to pay 6 helpers to do the planting and also pay off a pending loan. 

This client has big dreams, He says he is scared they won't come true.  He wants the children to graduate from college and he also wants to build a house because the one he has is made of wattle and daub. This way he can offer his family a better life. He says that to do this he will work from day to day so he can attain it, hoping to God and the kindness shown from those from Kiva.

loans.use: to pay rent on the land, $150 and buy 8 sacks of fertilizer at an average of $50. The rest will be to pay for 6 helpers to plant. He will also pay off a pending loan.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es:
La señora María de los Ángeles de 29 años de edad, tiene un hijo que dependen de ella, es madre soltera, vive en casa de un familiar, radica en la comunidad de  San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras, y se dedica desde hace 03 años  al negocio de venta de flores, adornos, útiles escolares, bolsas para regalos entre otros, sus clientes son los amigos y personas que llegan a comprar a su casa los adornos. Doña María es una mujer trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante.
Ella está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de cestas, bolsas para regalos, peluches, cartulinas y útiles escolares, y material para las fotocopiadoras. Con el apoyo del crédito ella suplirá la necesidad de financiamiento y de esa forma tendrá más productos que ofrecer para el día de las madres.
Doña María su sueño es tener su propia casa.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Mayo del 2014.
texts.en:
Señora María de los Ángeles is 29 years old and has one son who depends on her.  She is a single mother who lives in her family's home in the community of San Lorenzo, a valley in southern Honduras, and for three years she has made a living through a business that sells flowers, decorations, school supplies, and bags for gifts among other things.  Her customers are her friends and people who come to shop at her house for decorations.  Doña María is a hard-working woman with the desire to be successful in life.

She is asking for a loan to buy baskets, bags for gifts, stuffed toys, cardboard, school supplies, and photocopier materials.  With the help from the loan she will fulfill her need for financing and will have more products to offer for mother's day.

Doña María's dream is to have her own house.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - May 2014

loans.use: to buy baskets, bags for gifts, stuffed toys, cardboard, school supplies, and photocopier materials for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for maintenance and to purchase supplies to fertilize her crops.

loans.name: Ayawa

texts.fr:
Agée de 34 ans mariée  et  mère de deux enfants , Ayawa  réside dans le quartier d’Agoè. Depuis  5 ans, elle vend des emballages plastiques, les mèches et les tissages et s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au grand marché de Lomé  et les revend.
Ayawa  sollicite un prêt pour agrandir son commerce  afin d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire et participer aux dépenses de sa famille
texts.en:
Aged 34, married with two children, Ayawa lives in the Agoè neighborhood. For the past five years, she has been selling plastic bags, hair extensions and hair weaves. Twice a month she resupplies at the main market of Lomé and then resells.
 
Ayawa is requesting a loan to expand her business, so that she can increase her turnover and participate in managing household expenses.

loans.use: buy 60 hair extensions, 14 hair weaves and 20 plastic bags

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda works hard to support her family. Imelda is married and has a business buying and selling firewood and charcoal in the Philippines.

Imelda requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of firewood and sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers.

Imelda has been in this business for 2 years now.

In the future, Imelda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of firewood and sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Imelda is 43 years old and has five children who are in school.

Imelda has a food vending business in the Philippines. Imelda requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional ingredients and items for her food vending business.

Imelda has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Imelda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients and items for her food vending business.

loans.name: Héctor Valmore

texts.es:
Héctor de 44 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado de educación basica; esta acompañado , su pareja trabaja en los oficios domesticos, tienen dos hijos de los cuales uno vive en casa y esta estudiando y la otra esta acompañada.

Él se dedica a trabajar con ganado de repasto lo ha hecho por unos 15 años, para ir haciendo un patrimonio para su familia, ademas trabaja la agriculutra y  en una carpinteria como empleado.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar un ternero, le mejorara mucho porque tiene la oportunidad de comprar ganado y por lo tanto con un poco de esfuerzo tendra mejor calidad de vida. La necesidad satisfecha es la de poder comprar mas ganado, sus sueños son seguir trabajando para darles una buena educación a su hijo y a la vez crecer en el negocio para tener un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Héctor is 44 years old. He attended school until the ninth grade. He is married and his wife does household chores. They have two children, one who lives at home and studies, and one who is married. 

He makes a living by raising cattle, which he has done for the past 15 years, in order to create an estate for his family. He also works in agriculture and in a carpentry workshop.

He will use the loan that he has requested from CREDICAMPO to purchase a calf. This will help him a lot because he has the opportunity to purchase cattle and, with some effort, he will have a better quality of life. This will satisfy his need to purchase more cattle. 

His dream is to continue working to provide a good education to his son and grow his business to have a better future.

loans.use: to buy a calf.

loans.name: Irenea

texts.en:
Irenea works hard to support her family. Irenea is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Irenea requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like vegetables, spices, meat, fish, noodles, etc. for her food production business.

Irenea has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Irenea would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like vegetables, spices, meat, fish, noodles for her food production business.

loans.name: Jennalyn

texts.en:
Jennalyn is 29 years old and has three children. Jennalyn is married and has three children who are in school.

Jennalyn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Jennalyn requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Jennalyn has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jennalyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is 57 years old and married with three children. Jesusa works very hard to provide for them.

Jesusa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like soft-drinks, canned goods, detergent soap, shampoo, candies, etc. to sell.

Jesusa has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items such as soft-drinks, canned goods, detergent soap, shampoo, candies, etc. 

Jesusa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like soft-drinks, canned goods, detergent soap, shampoo, candies to sell.

loans.name: Ayawa

texts.fr:
Née en 1980, elle est célibataire et mère de deux enfants à Bè. Elle était  dans la vente du pain  depuis 2001. Mais depuis deux ans elle est dans la restauration où elle vend des ignames frites. Elle achète les ignames en gros dans un marché local et prépare la nourriture qu’elle revend  à sa devanture. Elle s’approvisionne une fois par semaine.
Elle sollicite ce microcrédit pour agrandir son restaurant et ajouter d’autres produits complémentaires afin de satisfaire les clients et d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire.
texts.en:
Born in 1980, she is a single mother of two children, living in Bè. She was a bread merchant since 2001. But for the past two years she has been in the food preparation business where she sells fried yams.

She buys yams wholesale from a local market and prepares the food she sells from her shopfront. She resupplies once a week. 

She is requesting this micro-credit loan to expand her restaurant by adding other complementary products, so as to satisfy customers and increase her turnover.

loans.use: buy 120 yam tubers

loans.name: Maria Aurora

texts.es:
La señora  María de  47 años de edad es madre soltera,  vive con sus dos hijos que dependen de ella tiene casa propia, radica en la comunidad de la criba san Lorenzo , valle al sur de Honduras, y se dedica desde hace 03  años  a la venta de abarrotería como ser: detergentes, frescos, churros, jabón, pollo, carnes, embutidos, granos básicos y mas, la señora María  es una mujer micro empresaria que está saliendo adelante sola con sus hijos y en sus ratos libres ella elabora hamacas, que  es otra fuente de ingresos que ella tiene en su hogar, ella involucra a su familia en las tareas diarias, asiste a la iglesia evangélica y es una persona que quiere salir adelante actualmente solo mantiene créditos con Prisma.
Doña María está solicitando el préstamo para surtir con detergentes, frescos, churros, jabón, pollo, carnes, embutidos, granos básicos y mas ya que quiere mejorar su pulpería  porque en esta época  de invierno ella vende bastante ya que viene la época de siembra en esa zona y ella vende bastante con los campesinos.
Doña María su sueño es mejorar su casa y su negocio.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - mayo del 2014.
texts.en:
María, 47, is a single mother.  She lives in her own house with her two dependent children in the community of La Criba, San Lorenzo, Valle, in the south of Honduras.  She has sold groceries for three years: detergent, soft drinks, chips, soda, chicken, meat, cold cuts, basic grains, and other products.

María's a micro-entrepreneur who is getting ahead on her own with her children.  In her free time she makes hammocks, which is another source of income for her household.  She involves her family in the daily tasks, attends an evangelical church, and is a person who wants to get ahead.  Currently she has loans only with Prisma.

María's requesting the loan to stock up on detergent, soft drinks, chips, soap, chicken, meat, cold cuts, basic grains, and other products because she wants to improve her store.  In the winter season she sells a lot because planting time is approaching in the area and she sells a lot to the farmers.

María's dream is to improve her house and her business.

San Lorenzo, Honduras, May 2014

loans.use: to stock up on products

loans.name: Juan Angel

texts.es:
El señor Juan Ángel  de 56  años de edad, no tiene hijos que dependen de él, vive con su conyugue, en su casa propia, radica en la comunidad san Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras, y se dedica desde hace 03 años  al negocio de venta de abarrotería en general como: frijoles, maseca, manteca, aceites, frescos, churos, pollo, embutidos y otros, sus clientes son los amigos y personas que a diario transitan por su casa, cuenta con casa propia.
Don Juan está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de jabón, churros, granos básicos, frescos, etc., con el apoyo del crédito el mejorar su economía y surtirá el negocio y por ende tendrá mejores ganancias.
El su sueño es tener un buen negocio para ahorrar para su vejes.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Mayo del 2014.
texts.en:
Juan Ángel  is 56 years old. He does not have children whom he supports. He lives with his wife in their own home, which is located in the San Lorenzo community in the southern valley of Honduras. 

For the past 3 years, he has worked at his small general store, selling merchandise like beans, corn flour, butter, oil, beverages, churros, chicken, deli meat, etc. His customers are friends and people who travel to his home daily, since he has his own home.

Juan is requesting a loan to purchase soap, churros, staple grains, beverages, etc. With the loan, he hopes to improve his financial situation and stock his business so that he can earn more income. 

His dream is to have a good business so that he can save money for when he is older.

loans.use: to purchase soap, churros, staple grains, sodas, etc. for his business.

loans.name: José Dimas

texts.es:
José de 55 años de edad, no estudio,  esta casado su pareja trabaja en los oficios domesticos, son padres de  dos hijos de los cuales uno reside en Estados Unidos y la otra esta casada y tiene su propio hogar.

José trabaja la agricultura, y es por esa razón que el préstamo lo necesita para comprar semilla de maíz, abono, pesticidas, herbicidas y para pago de mano de obra. De esta manera seguira trabajando y poder tener granos basicos para la alimentación de su familia y por lo tanto tendran mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José is 55 years old. He did not attend school, he is married, and his wife works in the home. They are the parents of two children. One child lives in the United States and the other is married and has his own household.

José works in agriculture, so he needs this loan to purchase corn seeds, fertilizer, pesticides, and herbicides, and to pay laborers. This way, he will continue working so that he can provide staple grains to nourish his family, and he will have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase corn seeds, fertilizer, pesticides, and herbicides, and to pay laborers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase merchandise to use in her business (flower sales)

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe works hard to support her family. Ma. Fe is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Ma. Fe requested a 14,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

Ma. Fe has been in this business for 21 years now.

In the future, Ma. Fe would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business

loans.name: Kayal Group

texts.en:
Given its abundance, firewood is a common domestic fuel in India, especially in rural households. Mariyammal, who hails from Maiyaladuthurai in Tanjore district of Tamil Nadu, cooks food using a makeshift cookstove that runs on firewood. Many women living in her neighborhood are dependent on similar cookstoves and firewood. 

Unfortunately, these women are putting themselves at the brink of contracting fatal lung diseases such as lung cancer, pneumonia, bronchitis, etc., as they inhale a high volume of smoke emanating from burning firewood every day. 

Mariyammal has teamed up with eleven other women to purchase low-smoke cookstoves available in the market. All these women earn a living by small livelihood activities. Their earnings are not sufficient to purchase the smokeless stoves. So, they wish to borrow an amount of INR 16,800 to buy twelve low-smoke cookstoves. 

A loan from you will help them breathe safer air while preparing food for their families.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 41 years old and has four children. Jocelyn is married and one of her children is currently in school.

Jocelyn is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Jocelyn has been in pig fattening for two years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Jocelyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ma. Judith

texts.en:
Ma. Judith is 47 years old and married with four children.

Ma. Judith works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Ma. Judith has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Ma. Judith aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is 47 years old and married with four children. 

Marcelina is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Marcelina requested a 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Marcelina has been in pig fattening for three years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Marcelina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for his son’s education.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: pay for treatment and medicine.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy electric scissors and a generator.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy fabric and renovate her workplace.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To cover his mother's treatment and medicine

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase more raw materials for her business.

Leticia has been in this business for 30 years, and Leticia earns more income from food vending.

Leticia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials for her business

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 51 years old and has five children. Lilia is married and three of her children are currently in school.

Lilia is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Lilia requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase vitamins, feed and vaccines for her pigs.

Lilia has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lilia would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins, feed and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase mobile phones and mobile accessories, as wells as renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and iron.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 41 years old and has seven children. Luzviminda is married and three of her children are currently in school.

Luzviminda is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Luzviminda requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Luzviminda has been in pig fattening for three years now and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Luzviminda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ilgar

texts.en:
Ilgar is a 48-year-old man. He is married and has a son. Ilgar is engaged in husbandry and has a small income that isn't enough for his family's welfare. It can't satisfy even their basic needs. The borrower has a great desire to have financial stability and better living conditions for his family. 

Ilgar requested a loan and was approved with the joint initiative between Kiva and VFAC. The start-up program gives people a chance to start businesses. He will use this loan to build a greenhouse for cultivation of vegetables. Ilgar awaits your support.

loans.use: To build a greenhouse for cultivation of vegetables

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 59 years old and widowed with six children.

Lydia earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Lydia is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

Lydia has been in pig fattening for 20 years and also earns additional income from firewood vending.

Lydia is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream, which is to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and iron.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fresh fish

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a generator and an oversewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and iron.

loans.name: Rigo Alberto

texts.es:
Rigo de 38 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, esta casado su pareja trabaja en oficios domesticos, son padres de dos hijos que viven en casa.

Rigo trabaja con ganado bovino lo ha hecho por unos seis años, lo aprendio de la familia de la esposa y decidio hacerlo para tener un ingreso economico mejor, ademas es empleado antes solo se dedicaba a la aagricultura.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar ganado de repasto; le mejorara mucho mas que tendra mas ganado y por lo tanto mas ingresos economicos. Sus sueños son trabajar muy fuerte para crecer en su negocio y  que sus hijos tengan oportunidades de seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Rigo is 30 years old. He went to school through sixth grade. He is married, and his wife works on household chores. They are parents of two children who live at home.

Rigo works with cattle, which he has done for six years. He learned to raise cattle from his wife’s family and he decided to do it to have a better economic income. Now he is employed; before he only worked in agriculture. 

The loan he is requesting from CREDICAMPO is to buy cattle pasture land. This will improve his business to have more cattle and therefore more income. His dreams are to work very hard to grow his business and that his children will have the opportunity to continue their studies.

loans.use: to buy cattle pasture land

loans.name: Ludy

texts.en:
As a married parent of one children, Ludy works hard to support her family.  She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Ludy is borrowing PHP 20,500 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like sugar, milk, etc., for her food vending business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.  Ludy has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like sugar, milk, etc,

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Aida works hard to support her family.  She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling fish and raising pigs. Aida is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell, like candies, milk, chips, canned goods, etc., for her general store business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.  Aida has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell, like candies, milk, chips, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her son's education.

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es:
Doña Maria es una persona muy responsable y honesta, vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Su negocio es la venta de productos plásticos desde hace 5 años, actividad que realiza de manera ambulante en su comunidad y en los caseríos cercanos a la misma.
Doña María está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de compra de mas producto como ser: platos, vasos, coladores, tenedores, cucharas, valdes, tazas, pocillos, pazcones,  entre otras; que necesita para seguir desarrollando su negocio. Ella espera que el préstamo le sirva de mucha ayuda ya que gracias a el contara con el producto suficiente para así cubrir los pedidos de sus clientes y así mismo satisfacer las necesidades de estos, de igual manera que sus ventas aumentes, y gracias a este ganar más ingresos que beneficien el estilo de vida de la familia en el hogar.
Ella espera que su negocio siga  creciendo negocio y de esta manera seguir apoyando a su familia y que sus hijos puedan continuar con los estudios para que tengan mayores oportunidades en el futuro.

Choluteca, Honduras – Mayo 2014
texts.en:
Maria is a very responsible and honest person who lives with her husband and 3 children in a community in the south of Honduras. She has been selling plastic products for the past 5 years. She does this going door to door in her community and the surrounding villages of the area.

Maria is requesting a loan so she can buy more product like plates, glasses, strainers, knives, forks, spoons, pails, cups, bowls, garbage cans, etc. that she needs to continue to develop her business. She hopes that the loan will be of great help as thanks to it she can have sufficient product to cover the orders of her clients and satisfy their needs. At the same time her sales should grow and thanks to this make more income which will benefit the lifestyle of her family. She hopes to continue to expand her business in this way so that she can continue to support her family. She wants her children to continue with their studies so that they have better opportunities in the future. Choluteca, Honduras – May 2014

loans.use: to buy plates, glasses, strainers, knives, forks, spoons, pails, cups, bowls, garbage cans, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Eden works hard to support her family.  She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling fish.  Eden is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy items to sel,l like shampoo, groceries, etc. for her general store business.

Eden has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Chanda

texts.en:
Chanda is 37 years old.  She is married and has three children, who are in school.  She works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Chanda has borrowed and repaid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from selling wood and bamboo.  She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Estela works hard to support her family.  She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Estela is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional fishing nets for her fishing business.

Estela has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF.   She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing nets

loans.name: Loma Linda Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario está integrado por cuatro socias exitosas en su vida laboral, lo coordina la señora Sobeyda de 34 años de edad y soltera, es costurera se ha dedicado a este negocio por más de cinco años, además comercializa ropa nuea, el crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de inventario como es camisetas, blusas, pantalones lee, kalua, telas sincatex, zipper, etc., este crédito lo solicita para cubrir parte de la demanda que está teniendo esta emporada. Otra de las socia es la señora Yelba de 58 años de edad comerciante de ropa en su comunidad desde hace tres años, la señora Noga de 30 años de edad dedicada a la venta de ropa nueva hace cinco años, y por ultimo pero no menos importante la señora Blanca de 61 años de edad comerciante de ropa de segunda en su comunidad.
texts.en:
This communal bank is composed of 4 members who have enjoyed success in their work lives. It is coordinated by Sobeyda who is 34 years old and single. She is a seamstress who has been working in this business for more than 5 years. She also sells new clothing. She is requesting a loan to purchase inventory such as T-shirts, blouses, Lee and Kalua jeans, Sincatex fabric, zippers, etc. She needs the loan to fill some of the orders she has for this season.

The other members are Yelba who is 58 years old. She has sold clothing in her community for 3 years and Noga who is 30 years old and she has been selling new clothing for 5 years. And last but not any less important is Blanca who is 61 years old who sells second hand clothing in her community.

loans.use: to buy T-shirts, blouses, Lee and Kalua jeans, Sincatex fabric, zippers, etc.

loans.name: Saraswathi Shg Group

texts.en:
“Saraswathi” is a Self Help Group at Karuppur village, Tamil Nadu, which is under the local NGO called “PAT”. The group has been in existence for more than 6 years. The total number of members in the group is 15. Sudha is the leader of this SHG. She is married to Mr. Kannadhasan who works as a daily wage farmer. They have two children and the family is living in their own house. 

The members of the group have received microfinance loans from “PAT” for three years, one after another, repaying the loan amount regularly on time. They have taken loans to improve their livelihoods.

Now the group members need a loan to purchase a smokeless stove which is produced by Greenway Grameen Infra. This stove costs the very low price of INR 1400, and the reduction in indoor air pollution means healthier women and healthier families. Healthier indoor air quality benefits young children and women who spend the maximum amount of time in and around the kitchen.

Your lending will help these women to live healthier lives.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos de 64 años de edad, agricultor, no estudió por la pobreza en que sus padres vivían, esta casado y es padre de tres hijos de 32, 29 y 25 años de edad, los cuales ya todos están casados. Por lo tanto ya no dependen de él. Su esposa no trabaja pero se dedica a los oficios domésticos del hogar, mientras que Santos se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 50 años, este trabajo lo aprendió de su padre quien toda su vida se dedico a la siembra de maíz, para llegar a su trabajo Santos tiene que caminar un kilometro todos los días, trabaja en el horario de 6:00 am a 11:00 am. Y por la tarde se va a cuidar una vaca que tiene.

El préstamo que esta solicitando en CREDICAMPO, es para comprar semilla, abono y agroquímico para tener una mejor cosecha y pues aumentará sus ingresos junto a su esposa.

El sueño de santos es poder mejorar su vivienda, llegar a tener seis vacas lecheras y comprar un terreno en el cual tendrá a sus animales.
texts.en:
Santos is 64 years old and is a farmer. He did not study due to the poverty his parents lived in. He is married and the father of three children aged 25, 29 and 32 years old. All of them are married so they are not dependent on him. His wife doesn't work but does the housework, while Santos farms as he has been doing for 50 years. He learned this work from his father who grew corn all his life. Santos has to walk one km to get to his work, which he does every day, working from 6 am until 11 am. In the afternoons he takes care of a cow that he has.

The loan that he is requesting from CrediCampo is to buy seeds, manure and agrochemicals to produce a better harvest and increase his income together with his wife. Santo's dream is to be able to make improvements to his house and have six milk cows and buy a plot of land to keep his animals.

loans.use: to buy seeds. manure and agrochemicals to produce a better harvest.

loans.name: Vadamalli Shg Group

texts.en:
Latha is the leader of “Vadamalli” Self Help Group which contains 11 other members from the same locality of Pattam village, Tamil Nadu.  She is 41 years old and she is married to Mr. Rajadurai. He is a daily wage worker in agriculture fields. Latha graduated from school. She has three daughters and two sons who all are studying. 
  
The women in this group spend 2 to 3 hours every morning and night inhaling harmful smoke released by the burning of firewood. They are, in fact, exposing themselves to diseases such as bronchitis, lung cancer, pneumonia, etc. These women don’t want to turn a blind eye towards the adversities of using the primitive cook stoves. Rather, they wish to replace the old cook stoves with new, low-smoke ones. However, their marginal savings every month are not sufficient to pay for a smokeless stove.

 So, they wish to be granted a loan of INR 16,800 to purchase 12 cook stoves. They will repay the loan amount within the stipulated time period.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove

loans.name: Magarasi Shg Group

texts.en:
Papanasam is a small village in Tanjore district of Tamil Nadu, India. Kogila is the leader of a five-woman self help group called “Magarasi.” They have been receiving microfinance loans from the local NGO “People’s Action for Transformation” (PAT) for the last five years and have been making on time repayments. Kogila lives in her own home with her child while her husband works as daily wage worker in agriculture fields.

Kogila (first from the left side with her hand raised) and the other four members of her group are seeking a loan to buy smokeless stoves made by Grameen Infra. This stove can use any type of solid biomass fuel and produces 70% less smoke while using 65% less fuel than traditional mud cook stoves.

Currently all members of the group are using conventional firewood stoves, which produce a lot of smoke emissions and negatively affect their families’ long-term health. With a Kiva loan, members of the “Magarasi” self help group will be able to purchase a smokeless stove and use less fuel while contributing to the longevity of their families.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove

loans.name: Thendral Shg Group

texts.en:
Vasanthi (40) is a married woman living in Papanasam Village of Tamil Nadu, India. Her husband is a shepherd. They have two children; both are studying in the government school. She is the group leader of the “Thendral” Self-Help-Group (SHG), which has been receiving loans from the local NGO “People’s Action for Transformation” (PAT) for the last five years. In addition, her group has been making on time repayments.

Vasanthi and her group are requesting a Kiva loan to purchase a smokeless stove from Grameen Infra, a sustainable stove manufacturer. This small loan will be repaid in easy installments.

Household air pollution from open fires kills 4 million people every year and is one of the top health risks in South Asia. The Greenway Smart Stove reduces smoke emissions by up to 80% while requiring minimal fuel which can be in the form of wood, cow dung, or agricultural waste. Most importantly, the stove reduces household air pollution, preserving the health of those who use it.

The five group members (Including Vasanthi) are thankful to Kiva lenders for giving them the opportunity to be more sustainable while saving money.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 25,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of households goods to sell like soap, canned goods, eggs, and other items for her general store business.

Elizabeth has been in this business for 3 years. Elizabeth earns more income from pre-paid mobile load.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Elizabeth has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of households goods to sell like soap, canned goods, eggs, and other items

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Magdalena works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell weaving bamboo business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store and raising pigs. Magdalena is borrowing 15,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional bamboo to weave for her buy-and-sell weaving bamboo business.

Magdalena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional bamboo to weave

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a generator and an over-sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seafood, such as fish, shrimp, and clams, for her store.

loans.name: Hanzel

texts.en:
Hanzel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle for her motorcycle transport business.

Hanzel has been in this business for five years. Hanzel earns additional income from fishing and raising pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Hanzel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to afford sending her children to college, and she hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Devi Shg Group

texts.en:
Jayanthi is a 45-year-old lady residing in Thiruvalangadu, a small village in Tamil Nadu, India. She has two children.  

Jayanthi (standing with her hand raised) is the leader of the 11-member “Devi” Self-Help Group (SHG). The group has been receiving microfinance loans from the local NGO “People’s Action for Transformation” (PAT) for the last five years.

Jayanthi and her group would like to take a Kiva loan to purchase a Greenway smart smokeless stove. Each group member is requesting a small loan of INR 1400 (per borrower) which will be repaid in easy installments. The Greenway smart stove is a single burner, high-efficiency cook stove designed for long-term, everyday use. The stove can use any type of solid biomass fuel including wood, cow dung and agricultural waste. It also produces 70% less smoke while using 65% less fuel than traditional mud cook stoves. 

Jayanthi and her group have the opportunity to save time and cut a recurring fuel expense all while being able to cook in a healthier environment. This stove has also been tested and certified by the Ministry of New & Renewable Energy (MNRE), Government of India.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove

loans.name: Alh Usaini

texts.en:
Alh Usaini is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Alh Usaini joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his  children: Anas, Hamida, and  Yahaya. Alh Usaini is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. 

For the first time, Alh Usaini will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products such as sand. With access to high quality inputs, Alh Usaini can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and  earn up to $2000/ha: more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  

When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make this year  as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money  to build a better home.” Alh Usaini is not thinking about this year alone; he expressed that his long-term goal is to “become the most profitable farmer in my community.” With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.en:
Soledad works hard to support her family. Soledad is married and has a business buying and selling sea cucumbers in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of sea cucumbers to sell.

Soledad has been in this business for 2 years now.

In the future, Soledad would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of sea cucumbers to sell

loans.name: Melisa

texts.en:
Melisa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines.
Melisa requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.
Melisa has been in this business for 16 years now.
Melisa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Sani

texts.en:
Sani remembers the extreme starvation that his family faced during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now, Sani, like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Sani, is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 35 bags per hectare this season. 

“In 5 years, I want to ensure other members of my community are lifted out of poverty,” expressed Sani. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Lolita works hard to support her family.
She has a buy-and-sell dried coconut meat business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from selling bananas. Lolita is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of coconut to sell.
Lolita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of coconut to sell

loans.name: Alh Gambo

texts.en:
Alh Gambo remembers the starvation his family faced  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona member. Now Alh Gambo, like all Babban Gona members, can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 

The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Alh Gambo, is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 50 bags per hectare this season. Alh Gambo has big dreams for his future: “In 5 years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community,” he expressed. With this loan, Alh Gambo is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 38 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Analyn has borrowed and paid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from food vending.

Analyn aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Chheang

texts.en:
Chheang, who is 25 years old, lives and operates her farming business in Ta Lou District, Pursat Province, Cambodia. So far, it has been nearly ten years that Chheang has been involved in farming. Working as a farmer is the main job that she does regularly to support her only child.

At this time, Chheang is requesting her first loan from Kiva to build a hygienic latrine in her house. With this low-interest loan, Chheang hopes that this hygienic latrine will improve her family's living standards and health conditions once it is completely built. She expresses her gratitude to all the lenders for their kindness.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine

loans.name: Thoeurn

texts.en:
Thoeurn, 54, is an experienced farmer who lives in a remote area of Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province of Cambodia. With his experience in farming for more than thirty years, Thoeurn is able to earn a decent income to support his wife and his four children.
Besides the responsibility of his own family, Thoeurn still has a very old mother that he visits and takes care of very often. Recently, his old and lovely mother passed away because of an incurable disease. So that she can rest in peace, Thoeurn is applying for a loan from KIVA to prepare a funeral for his mother based on her religious beliefs. He would like to express his gratitude for all the lenders, and he hopes that this loan will help reduce his sadness.

loans.use: to prepare a funeral

loans.name: Sokong

texts.en:
Sokong is a hard working farmer in Batheay District, Kompong Cham Province, Cambodia. At the age of 51, Khoeun has five children, two of whom are in school and three of whom are married. Her family income is about US $4 per day.

For further technology education, Sokong's school children need a personal computer to practice at home after they have learned some lessons in school. Since she cannot afford a new computer, Sokong is taking a loan form Kiva in the amount of US $600 to buy a computer for her children. She hopes that after the computer is installed in her house, her children will have more time to focus on their computer practicing.

loans.use: to buy a computer for her children to learn to use

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 30 years old and is married with three children in school.

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Analyn requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional feed for her pigs.

Analyn has been raising pigs for three years now and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Analyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene works hard to support her family. Arlene is married and has a buy and sell fish business in the Philippines.

She requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell.

Arlene has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Arlene would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria is 37 years old and is married with five children in school.

She is in the agricultural business farming vegetables in the Philippines. Candelaria requested an 8,000 PHP  loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and new seeds for her business.

Candelaria has been farming vegetables for two years now and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Candelaria would like to save money to expand her business and save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and new seeds for her business.

loans.name: Ritchel

texts.en:

Ritchel has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from buying and selling fish and raising pigs.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is 43 years old and has nine children. She is married and three of her children are currently in school.
