Mercedita has been in pig fattening for five years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.
She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.
In the future, Mercedita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Merlita works hard to support her family. She has a firewood vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  

Merlita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of firewood to sell to her customers.

Merlita has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of firewood to sell to her customers

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma works hard to support her family. She is married and she has a business buying and selling firewood and charcoal in the Philippines. Norma has been in this business for six years now.

Norma requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy more firewood and charcoal to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more firewood and charcoal to sell

loans.name: Alh Ummaru

texts.en:
Alh Ummaru remembers feeling extremely depressed as a result of a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona member. Now, as a Babban Gona member, Alh Ummaru like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 

The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the National average of 14. However, Alh Ummaru,  is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 35 bags per hectare this season.  Alh Ummaru has high hopes for the future: “In 5 years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community,” he said. With this loan, Alh Ummaru is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Rodelyn

texts.en:
Rodelyn is 33 years old and has four children. She is married and has three children who are currently in school.

Rodelyn is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rodelyn has been in the pig fattening business for three years, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Rodelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ramie

texts.en:
Ramie is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ramie is 30 years old and five of her children are currently in school.

Ramie has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 10 years. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for her weaving business. In the future, Ramie would like to save enough money that she can continue to afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Deborah De Samarie Group

texts.fr:
Jackson est le coordinateur de son groupe Deborah de Samarie. Il est marie et Il a 2 enfants. Il habite dans la région nord est d`Haïti ou de électricité est rare et de l’eau portable est très limitée. Jackson dirige son commerce d'articles divers pendants les 13 dernières années et Il va acheter produit divers (vetement, cosmetiques, chaussures, etc). Avant de ce commercer ce commerce Il était un profeseur. 

Il espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à grandir son commerce. Des autres membres Deborah de Samarie ont besoin d’un emprunt pour le commerce tel que ventes produits alimenteurs, boissons gazeuses, charbon, etc. Il déclare que son défi principal est de devenir un grand commerçant dans le département du nord. Il dit son but principal c’est d’avoir un grand commerce qui lui facilitera à construire une grande maison avec l’aide d’Esperanza Int.
texts.en:
Jackson is the co-ordinator for the Deborah De Samarie Group. He is married with two children. He lives in the north-east area of Haiti, where electricity isn't commonplace and clean drinking water is very limited. Jackson has been in the business of selling various items for the past 13 years. With this loan, he is planning to purchase various items, such as clothes, cosmetic products and shoes. Before starting this business, he worked as a teacher.

He hopes that this loan will help him grow his business. The other members of the Deborah De Samarie Group need a loan to help them with their businesses in selling foodstuffs, carbonated drinks and charcoal. Jackson has stated that his main challenge is to become an important retail trader in the northern region. He says that his main goal is to run a large business which will allow him to build a large house. He plans on achieving this with the help of Esperanza International.

loans.use: to purchase various items, such as cosmetic products and shoes, etc

loans.name: Pha

texts.en:
Pha is 34 years old and a mother of three lovely children who are enrolling in local primary school right now. Her family resides in Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province. Pha and her husband are farmers in their own rice field near their house. This career allows them to earn around USD 7 in one day.
So far, Pha has been involved in the farming business for more than ten years. Pha wants to accelerate her farming process by using a suitable plowing machine but she cannot afford it. Now she is borrowing some money from KIVA to buy a plowing machine to use in her plowing process. She expects that the plowing machine will help her to save time and energy in her farming operation.

loans.use: to buy a plowing machine

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Sophea, 22, is a farmer who lives in the Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province. She has only one baby son and her husband also is a farmer. Sophea and her husband work on a small rice field next to their house. The average net profit of her family is 5 USD per day.

Sophea now is living far away from the water source so it is quite hard to get water for daily usage. To ensure a convenient way of getting the water, Sophea is borrowing a loan from Kiva to dig a well just behind her house. Sophea is very happy with this low-interest loan and she hopes that it will be easy and time-saving for her to get the water after the well is completely made. She would like to thank all lenders who always help poor people like her to gain such a great financial support.

loans.use: to dig a well.

loans.name: Kor

texts.en:
Kor is a 33-year-old married man who lives in Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province. He has only one child who is a student in a primary school in the village. To make a living, Kor works on a rice field near his house and he can earn US $5 per day.

Kor is living in a small, old house and he wants to build a new house that is suitable for living, but he doesn't have enough money. Therefore, he is borrowing some money from Kiva to complete the building of a new house. This is the first time that Kor has gotten a loan form KHL and he promises to pay all the money with interest back to HKL punctually based on the repayment schedule.

loans.use: to build a house

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a farming flowers business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy flower fertilizers and other farm supplies for her business.

Violeta has been in this business for 10 years. Violeta earns more income from food vending.

Violeta has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy flower fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Gerlie

texts.en:
Gerlie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a manicure/pedicure service business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials like nail polish, nail cutter, and nipper for her manicure/pedicure service business.

Gerlie has been in this business for 2 years. Gerlie earns more income from food vending.

Gerlie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her manicure/pedicure business

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Shirley works hard to support her family. She has a computer gaming machine rental business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from frozen foods vending. 

Shirley is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional computer gaming machines for her business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. Shirley hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional computer gaming machines for her rental business

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a 48-year old married woman with three children, one of whom is currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Lilian has a direct selling tupperware products business in the Philippines. Lilian requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stocks of tupperware products to sell.

Lilian has been in this business for 14 years. Lilian would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of tupperware products to sell

loans.name: Miralyn

texts.en:
Miralyn is 23 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom are currently in school.

Miralyn is in the agricultural business, farming banana and coconut in the Philippines. Miralyn requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Miralyn has been farming banana and coconut for 3 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Miralyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Rosadelima

texts.en:
Rosadelima works hard to support her family. Rosadelima is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Rosadelima requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

Rosadelima has been in this business for 5 years now.

Rosadelima would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Khorn

texts.en:
Khorn, 61 years old, is a married woman who lives in Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province. Khorn has seven children in total and four of them are married. To make a living, she works on a rice field near her house. So far, it has been about 40 years that she has been working as a farmer. 

Khorn is living in a small and old house and she wants to build a new house that is suitable for living, but she does not have enough money. Therefore, she is borrowing some money from Kiva to complete the building of a new house. This is the first time that Khorn has gotten a loan form KHL and she promises to pay all the money with interest back to HKL punctually based on the repayment schedule.

loans.use: to build a house

loans.name: Malohat

texts.ru: Малохат живет в городе Куляб. У нее высшее образование. В течение 6 лет она работает в школе учительницей. Малохат имеет двух дочерей в возрасте 16 и 8 лет, и двух сыновей в возрасте 14 и 11 лет. Все дети учатся в школе. Муж Малохат является мясником. Он на центральном рынке города в своей мясной лавке занимается продажей мяса. Малохат помимо своей преподавательской деятельности, занимается еще швейным бизнесом. Она уже 6 лет ведет эту деятельность. Сейчас она хочет обновить свою старую машинку. Для этой цели Малохат просит кредит, на сумму которого собирается приобрести профессиональную швейную машинку. Этот кредит ей действительно нужен.
texts.en:
Malohat lives in the town of Kulyab. She has a higher education. Over the course of six years, she has been working in a school as a teacher. Malohat has two daughters aged 16 and 8, and two sons aged 14 and 11. All the children are in school. Malohat's husband is a butcher. In the central town market he sells meat in his butcher shop.

Malohat, in addition to her teaching activities, also has a sewing business. She has been doing this work for six years. Now she wants to upgrade her old machine. With this aim, Malohat is requesting a loan with which she intends to acquire a professional sewing machine. She really needs this loan.

loans.use: to purchase a professional sewing machine

loans.name: Koeun

texts.en:
Koeun, a 53-year-old married man, lives and operates a farming business in Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province. He has six children and they all are married. He has been operating this farming business for more than 20 years. His daily income is 5 USD per day.

Koeun is lacking some money to support his farming business now. That why he is requesting a loan to buy some farm supplies such as fertilizers, rice seeds, insecticides and other related materials. Koeun would like to express his gratitude to all generous lenders for their financial support to poor people like him.

loans.use: to buy some farm supplies.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Sokha, a 31-year-old married woman, lives in the Prey Chhor District of Kampong Cham Province. She has four children who are enrolled in school. Sokha and her husband are farmers in the rice fields who can earn US $5 per day to support their family. The profit that Sokha and her husband earn from the farming is not enough for their family.

To ensure her family's financial stability, Sokha wants to have one more business raising baby ducks and selling them when they are old enough. However, she does not have a decent capital investment to run her new business. Therefore, Sokha is now borrowing some money from Kiva to buy baby ducks to raise and sell when they are big enough.

loans.use: to buy baby ducks to raise and sell

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Anita works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Anita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional items like snack foods, biscuits, cooking oil, canned goods, detergent soap, and shampoo to sell for her general store business.

Anita has been sustaining her business activities through her past one loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia is 64 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Arsenia is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Arsenia has been farming vegetables for 44 years and also earns additional income from vegetables vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Elsa works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Elsa is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Elsa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 1 loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia works hard to support her family. Florencia is married and has a buy and sell herbal medicine business in the Philippines.

Florencia requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more herbal products to sell to her customers.

Florencia has been in this business for 14 years now.

Florencia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more herbal products to sell to her customers

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina is 39 years old and single with three children.

Merlina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks like coffee, bread, sugar, detergent soap, shampoo, and canned goods to sell.

Merlina has borrowed and paid 9 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Merlina aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 47 years old and married, with seven children.

Josephine works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional stocks to sell, like eggs, soy sauce, biscuits, canned goods, and soft drinks.

Josephine has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns additional income from farming vegetables.

Josephine aspires to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell, like eggs, soy sauce, biscuits, canned goods, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Kathleene

texts.en:
Kathleene is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Kathleene has been in this business for 2 years. Kathleene earns more income from farming vegetables and food vending.

Kathleene has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Shamsiya

texts.ru:
Шамсия шеф повар из города Куляб. Ей 42 года. Она более 4 лет работает в сфере услуг. Шамсия в своей столовой предлагает посетителям свои фирменные национальные блюда. Она очень вкусно готовит и ее клиенты всегда довольны ее блюдами. 
Шамсия замужняя женщина. Ее муж предоставляет услуги по перевозке пассажиров. Их старший сын служит в армии, дочь студентка, а младший сын учится в школе. Дочь также помогает матери в работе столовой. Шамсия сейчас нуждается в кредите. Ей необходимо дополнительно закупить столовые принадлежности для расширения своего дела. Она надеется на вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Shamsiya is a head chef from the town of Kulyab. She is 42 years old. For more than four years, she has been working in this sphere of service. In her own dining hall, Shamsiya offers visitors her signature national dishes. She cooks very delicious food and her customers are always pleased with her dishes.

Shamsiya is a married woman. Her husband offers services transporting passengers. Their elder son is serving in the army, their daughter is a student, and the youngest son goes to school. Her daughter also helps her mother working at the dining hall. Shamsiya now needs a loan. Additionally, she needs to buy tableware for expanding her work. She is in need of support.

loans.use: to acquire tableware

loans.name: Alambi

texts.ru:
Эту женщину преклонного возраста зовут Аламби. Ей 63 года, она из города Куляб. Аламби живет с сыновьями и невестками. У нее среднее специальное образование. В данный момент она занимается швейным делом. Она профессиональная швея и принимает заказы на пошив национальных платьев у себя дома. Сейчас ей необходимо купить модернизированную швейную машинку и для этоой цели она просит кредит.   
Аламби целеустремленная женщина. У нее большие планы по расширению бизнеса. В дальнейшем она хочет приобрести еще несколько электрических швейных машин и включить в это дело своих невесток. А сейчас она надеется на финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
This older lady is called Alambi. She is 63 years old and is from the town of Kulyab. Alambi lives with her sons and daughters-in-law. She has a specialized secondary education. Currently, she is engaged in sewing work. She is a professional seamstress and takes orders for making national dresses from her home. Now she needs to buy a modern sewing machine and with this aim she is requesting a loan.

Alambi is a determined woman. She has big plans for expanding her business. In the future, she wants to acquire few more electric sewing machines and to include her daughters-in-law in the work. And now she is hoping for financial support.

loans.use: to purchase a modern sewing machine for expanding her sewing business

loans.name: Ana Marie

texts.en:
Ana Marie is 49 years old and married with four children.

Ana Marie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Ana Marie has borrowed and paid off 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling bananas.

Ana Marie aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Marianie

texts.en:
Marianie is single and has a retail  banana business in the Philippines.  Marianie has been in this business for 5 years.

Marianie requested 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more bananas to sell to her customers.

In the future, Marianie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Lolita works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from manicure/pedicure service.  Lolita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional fishing net and gears for her fishing business.

Lolita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net and gears for her fishing business

loans.name: Beberna

texts.en:
Beberna works hard to support her family. Beberna is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

Beberna requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle.

Beberna has been in this business for 5 years now.

Beberna would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle

loans.name: Epefenia

texts.en:
Epefenia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a ice cream vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like milk and ice for her ice cream vending business.

Epefenia has been in this business for 8 years. Epefenia earns more income from a general store and farming vegetables.

Epefenia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her ice cream production business

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Helen works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store and raising pigs. Helen is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 51 years old and she has three children. She is married and has one child who is still in school.

Judith is in the agricultural business, pig-fattening in the Philippines. Judith requested a PHP 16,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Judith has been in pig-fattening for ten years now and has borrowed 21 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Judith would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business direct selling Avon products in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase more products from Avon to sell for her business direct selling Avon products.

Laura has been in this business for 14 years. She earns more income from a general store.

Laura has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more products from Avon to sell

loans.name: Lucerna

texts.en:
Lucerna works hard to support her family. Lucerna is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell. Lucerna has been in this business for 6 years now.

In the future, Lucerna would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta is 55 years old and married with nine children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like noodles, canned goods, milk, coffee, and chips.

Marietta has borrowed and paid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 28 years and also earns an income from vulcanizing shop.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Pacencia

texts.en:
Pacencia is 56 years old and married with eleven children.  With two children in school, Pacencia works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like can goods, egg, milk, sugar, chips, and soft drinks.

Pacencia has been in this business for 13 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Daisy works hard to support her family.

She has a retail vegetable business in the Philippines, and earns additional income raising pigs. Daisy requests 14,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

Daisy has sustained her business activities through 3 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream which is to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Patlynde

texts.en:
Patlynde is 55 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Patlynde is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Patlynde has been raising pigs for 7 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Harisu

texts.en:
Harisu remembers feeling depressed as a result of a particularly bad harvest. This is before he became a Babban Gona member. Now, as a Babban Gona member, Harisu, like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 

The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Harisu is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 35 bags per hectare this season.  Harisu has high hopes for the future; “In five years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community,” he said. With this loan, Harisu is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Abdullahi

texts.en:
Abdullahi remembers sinking into a deep depression last year as a result of a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona member. Now, Abdullahi, like all Babban Gona members, can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 

The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Abdullahi is ambitious and is aiming to reap 60 bags per hectare this season.  “In five years, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs,” expressed Abdullahi. With this loan, Abdullahi is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Na Tau 5 Group

texts.en:
Thuong is a 24-year-old  married woman with a 7- year-old child who attends primary school. She lives with her husband and her child in a Thai traditional house of a small remote village. 

They rely on agricultural production for a living and cultivate rice and canna and breed pigs. Despite their effort, the income was not enough to cover their  living expense and tuition fee. Her husband works extra for local construction employers. 

In order to have more earnings, Thuong intended to expand her business but she had difficulty due to lack of capital. At the same time, she was introduced to Anh Chi Em Program about its activities, which contained financial and non-financial support.  She has been very interested in taking part in those. This is her first loan in the Program and she will use the loan to buy piglets. 

Thuong believes that, together with the training on agriculture techniques, she could enhance productivity and the quality of her agriculture products.  This would improve considerably her family's income. When it succeeds, she will buy some new furniture for the house and new toys for her child. 

Thuong stands first from the right in the photo.

loans.use: to buy piglets.

loans.name: Santa Rosa Group

texts.es:
El comité Santa Rosa inicia el tercer ciclo, todas ellas se están ayudando, para que a través del trabajo en grupo y por medio de las capacitaciones vayan creciendo y mejorando sus vidas.
Maria es una de las integrantes, se dedica al trabajo humilde de vender empanadas de manera ambulante, es ella misma quien se encarga de hacerlas y luego las vende. Es muy luchadora y por sobre todo sacrificada. Pide este préstamo para la compra de carne, verduras, condimentos, huevos y otros insumos para poder seguir haciendo sus empandas para luego venderlas.
Todas las integrantes del grupo están sacrificándose por seguir ayudando a sus familias.
texts.en:
The Santa Rosa communal bank is beginning its third loan cycle. All of the women are helping each other so that through group work and through training, they will go on growing and improving their lives. 

Maria is one of the members. She has the modest job of selling empanadas on the street. It is she herself that is in charge of making them, and then selling them. She's very determined and, most of all, selfless. She is asking for this loan in order to buy meat, vegetables, condiments, eggs and other ingredients, so she can continue making her empanadas and then selling them.

All the members of the group are making sacrifices to continue helping their families.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, condiments, eggs and other ingredients to make empanadas.

loans.name: Miguel Santos

texts.es: Miguel está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que es la segunda vez que le brindan su apoyo va ser de mucha ayuda para el ya que la comrpa de pavos para la venta, de esta manera poder tener un ingreso extra ya que actualmente se dedica a su labor como obrero de campo,de esta manera seguira trabajando para poder dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y luchar por hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener su casa propia y darle una profesión a sus 2 hijos y tener un restaurant campestre”.
texts.en: Miguel is very grateful for the Kiva lenders, as this is the second time that they'll provide him their support. It will be very helpful to him in the purchase of turkeys to sell. In this way he can have extra income, since he currently makes a living working as a field worker. This is how he will continue working, to be able to provide a better quality of life to his family and fight to make his greatest dream a reality: "to have his own house and to give a profession to his two children, and to have a country restaurant."

loans.use: to buy turkeys wholesale.

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en:
Emerita is 42 years old and married with two children, one child attends school. Emerita works very hard to provide for them.

Emerita runs a retail charcoal business in the Philippines and requested 19,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional quantities of charcoal to sell.

Emerita has been in this business for 5 years. 

She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional quantities of charcoal to sell.

Pilar has borrowed and paid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Pilar aspires to save money to expand her business.

Lynly has farmed vegetables for 10 years and has previously borrowed 10 times from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lynly would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings.

Virginia has been farming rice for 15 years now, and has borrowed 22 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Virginia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.name: Agnes

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business. Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like sardines, noodles, shampoo, etc. to sell

loans.name: Carmelina

Rubielyn is 41 years old and married with six children, three of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, canned goods, chips, etc.

Rubielyn has borrowed and paid back seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Rubielyn aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, canned goods, chips, etc

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 42 years old and married.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell such as soap, shampoo, eggs, noodles, canned goods, etc.

Irene has borrowed and paid back nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns additional income from buying and selling flowers.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Irene aspires to save enough money so that she will be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell such as soap, shampoo, eggs, noodles, canned goods, etc

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Veronica works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Veronica is borrowing 14,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell such as canned goods, chips, eggs, noodles, sugar, etc. for her general store business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Veronica has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her achieve her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell such as canned goods, chips, eggs, noodles, sugar, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more grocery products to offer to his clients.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is very active and dynamic young man. Last year, he applied for his first loan from Kiva to purchase many advertising materials for his  advertising agency. The first loan helped Mohammed very much in improving his agency. He thanks Kiva lenders very much for their first loan. 

After he finished the repayment of the installments of the first loan, Mohammed applied for a second loan of 200,000 YER from Kiva lenders, to purchase another large printer in order to help him fulfill more of his work in a better way.

Mohammed hopes that his second loan will be financed.

loans.use: to purchase a new, large printer to help him fulfill more of his work in a better way

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is a hardworking businesswoman who has spent years in selling iced beverages and other products. Marie started her first business with a small amount of money in 1980. Over the years, she has permitted her family to live on a small economic activity. With dignity and discipline, she has made short progress in her life until today. 

Now she needs to diversify her economic activity by selling wide-margin products such peanut butter and frozen meat at her store. She turns to Zafen to obtain a loan, training and accompaniment. The loan will support her children’s education at 20% and will change her life conditions.

loans.use: to buy a freezer and beverages.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en: Jean shared that at a young age he had a passion for sewing.  From age 9 to 15, Jean could be found secretly using his uncle's sewing machine every time his uncle wasn't home. When discovered, he was punished for using or damaging the sewing machine. By the time he went to high school, his interest continued and he became the one who fixed his friends' pants by hemming, doing zipper installations, and sewing on buttons, patches and badges. It became obvious that he could earn a living in the sewing industry. His uncle finally understood Jean’s passion to be a tailor and for his 18th birthday, he offered him a small sewing machine. As a result of this precious gift, Jean quickly decided to open his business in the community. Jean has been very sensitive to satisfying both his internal and external customers. The business has gained a scope of influence and credibility from customers by knowing and using techniques and by exceeding their expectations for years. However, the business biggest challenge is to keep up with its economic efficiency, which is based on the market change, the selling price, the cost of resources, the sale price, and always providing a quality product with on time delivery to his clientele. Today, the business owner realizes that a course of action must be taken to reach efficiency within the business operation.  The business is in need of a loan in order to buy four regular sewing machines and some sewing materials, which will help satisfy his clientele, become more efficient, increase the business' annual sales by 15% and improve the business service strategies.

loans.use: To purchase four regular sewing machines and sewing materials.

loans.name: Wilfrid

texts.en: Wilfrid is the owner of Tifou Resto Bar, a small restaurant that offers customers savory and sweet pastries with natural juice. Tifou Resto Bar was created in 2008. Presently, Wilfrid uses three cooking machines. As the demand grows, he would like to acquire one oven, two stoves, and one freezer to be fully operational. With a loan from Zafen, Tifou Resto Bar will keep being a cozy place for snack eaters while tripling its sales over the coming years.

loans.use: to buy an oven, a stove, a food mixer, and food products

loans.name: Renette

texts.en: As a child, it was obvious that Renette had a natural hairdressing talent.  At home, school, and church, she was always the one to fashion the hair of her friends. She enjoyed doing what she loved the best. The idea to open her own cosmetics business was her dream while growing up. She enrolled at the University to study medical science after finishing her high school.  Later on, she was hired at the Haitian Ministry of Public Health. Even though she had a great steady job, she still dreamed about opening her own hair and makeup shop. In 2001, she was finally able to open her first cosmetics class training center. Six months later, with the help of her former students and the assistance of one beautician, she opened her shop. Today, Renette remains enthusiastic about the business she started and continues to grow with the trends and styles of today. Despite the business success, it is challenging to meet customers’ demands.  As a result, the business is in need of a loan to purchase more electric razors, more acrylic machines, more barbershop chairs and tables.

loans.use: To buy chairs, razors, hair dryers and other equipment

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed remembers feeling depressed  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona member. Now, Mohammed, like all Babban Gona members, can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 

The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Mohammed is ambitious and is aiming to reap 200 bags per hectare this season.  “In five years, I want to ensure other members of my community are lifted out of poverty,” expressed Mohammed. With this loan, Mohammed is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double his income and yield.

loans.name: Frantzdy

texts.en:
Frantzdy didn’t have enough money to go to college after finishing high school. Consequently, he had to think about opportunities that might help him to move forward. Later on, a friend gave him some money to go to a technical school. 

Frantzdy, instead of going to school, decided to open his dream business, which is a community restaurant. It was a very difficult decision to make. Friends and family members criticized him for not pursuing a higher education. However, for him, that was the best decision ever. After several years of operating the business efficiently, he has filled the needs of everyone living in the community. 

Today, the business’ challenge is to buy one more freezer, a blender, several fans, chairs and a table in order to produce more and satisfy more consumers. A loan will help the business to increase its production and capacity to better serve more customers. The business wants to increase its financial performance by 20%, while offering quality services to everyone living in the community of Carrefour Feuille.

loans.use: to purchase one oven, a freezer, and food products.

loans.name: Jolisa

texts.en:
Jolisa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines.  
Jolisa has been in this business for 5 years.

She requested 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like fish, meat, vegetables, and spices.

In the future, Jolisa would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like fish, meat, vegetables, and spices.

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma is 52 years old and married with six children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell such as soap, sugar, egg, cream, shampoo, etc.

Erma has borrowed and paid back 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from boarding house rental.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Erma aspires to save enough money so that she will be able to afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock, such as soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, and eggs

loans.name: Mizel

texts.en:
Mizel  is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a seaweed-culture business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 2 years and earns additional income from fishing.

She requests 17,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase seaweed and plastic rope for her seaweed-culture business.

She has sustained her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She wishes to save enough money to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional seaweed seedlings and plastic rope for her buisness.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 53 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living raising pigs in the Philippines. Thelma requests 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins.

Thelma earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables.

She works tirelessly to attain her dream which is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Enriquita

texts.en:
Enriquita is 45 years old and married with ten children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested 6,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase soap, noodles and other groceries.

Enriquita has borrowed and repaid 5 previous loans from NWTF. She has run the general store for 2 years and earns an income selling charcoal.

Enriquita aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase soap, noodles and other groceries.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Elizabeth works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal. Elizabeth is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc. for her general store business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business. Elizabeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials like gasoline and fishing net for her fishing business.

Susan has been in this business for six years. She earns more income from buying and selling fish.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Susan has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like gasoline and fishing net

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria works hard to support her family. Gloria is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Gloria has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Gloria would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, two of whom in school, Divina works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish.  Divina is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials like fishing net and gasoline for her fishing business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Divina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like fishing net and gasoline

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
Andrea is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell frozen foods business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks of frozen products to sell for her buy and sell frozen foods business.

Andrea has been in this business for 3 years. Andrea earns more income from food vending.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested additional loan to further build her business.

Andrea has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of frozen products to sell

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell peanut business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of peanut to sell for her buy and sell peanut business.

Rosalie has been in this business for 3 years. Rosalie earns more income from farming vegetables and pig raising.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested additional loan to further build her business.

Rosalie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college and expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of peanuts to sell

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 45 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Jessica has a furniture making business in the Philippines. Jessica requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Jessica has been in this business for 11 years.  In the future, Jessica would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her buisness

loans.name: Ma. Nezel

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Ma. Nezel works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling shrimp and charcoal. Ma. Nezel is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to  purchase additional stock like noodles, rice, spices, etc. to sell for her general store business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business. Ma. Nezel has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like noodles, rice, spices, etc. to sell

loans.name: Jelly

texts.en:
Jelly works hard to support her family. She  is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.  
Jelly  has been in this business for 2 years.

She requested 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase a new fishing boat.

In the future, Jelly would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a new fishing boat.

loans.name: Yohanna Amadu

texts.en:
Yohanna Amadu is a 54-year-old farmer from R/Tabo. As a Babban Gona member, Yohanna Amadu, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Yohanna Amadu can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 

The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the national average of 14. However, Yohanna Amadu is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Yohanna Amadu said, “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children: Emma, Yusuf,  and Ayuba, and in five years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double his yield and income

loans.name: Mayra Xiomara

texts.es:
La señora MAYRA de 32 años de edad,  tiene tres  hijos que dependen de ella vive con su conyugue, en su casa propia, radica en la comunidad Laure abajo  al sur de Honduras, y se dedica desde hace 05 años  al negocio de venta de golosinas y comida  como arroz con pollo, arroz con tallarín, tacos, pasteles, enchiladas, sopas de mondongo,  fresco de botella, su venta es con los empleados de las camaroneras, vecinos, amigos y personas que pasan por su casa. 
Doña Mayra está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de verduras, carne de pollo, arroz, condimentos, aceites y leña para cocinar, con el apoyo del crédito ella saldrá adelante, es un cliente que solicita por primera vez el crédito.
Su sueño  tener su propia casa. 
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Mayo del 2014.
texts.en:
Mayra is 32 years old and has three children who depend on her. She lives with her spouse in the home they own in the community of Laure, down in southern Honduras. For the past five years she has been working selling sweets and food like chicken and rice, chicken and noodles, tacos, cakes, enchiladas, tripe soup, and soft drinks. She sells these items to the employees of the local shrimp processing plants and to her friends, neighbors, and other locals that go by her house.

Mayra is requesting this loan to buy vegetables, chicken, rice, spices, oil, and woodfire for cooking. She will be able to get ahead with the help of this loan. This client is requesting a loan for the first time.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - May, 2014

loans.use: to buy vegetables, chicken, rice, spices, oil, and firewood.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La señora Martha de 60 años de edad, vive con su sobrina en su casa     propia, se dedica desde hace 27 años al negocio de venta de abarrotería en su negocio ella vende  frescos, churros, frijoles, arroz, maíz, lácteos, jabón, etc.  También cuenta con una línea de cosméticos como: Tintes de pelo, Glas para uñas, Cremas para la piel, Lociones para hombre y mujer, Gelatinas, etc.                  Radica en la cuidad de san Lorenzo al sur de Honduras, ella es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Doña Martha esta solicitando el préstamo para compra de productos para surtir la pulpería,  como pollo, arroz, frijoles, maseca, manteca, jabón, frescos, etc. con el apoyo de este crédito ella pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente nuevo con deseos de trabajar con Prisma y Kiva.
Su sueño es tener un buen negocio bien surtido, y luego más adelante dentro unos años viajar a Estados Unidos, a visitar a sus hijos que están en ese pais.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Mayo 2014.
texts.en:
Mrs. Martha, 60 years old, lives in her house with her niece. She makes a living, for 27 years now, from the business of selling groceries. In her store she sells sodas, donuts, beans, rice, corn, dairy products, soaps etc. She also has a cosmetics line, like: hair dyes, nail polish, body lotions, men and women perfumes, gelatin etc. She lives in the city of San Lorenzo, to the south of Honduras. She is an enterprising woman who wishes to get ahead, and fights every day to improve her quality of life. 

Doña Martha is requesting a loan to buy products to replenish her small grocery store, such as: chicken, rice, beans, corn flour, lard, soap, fresh produce etc. With the loan’s support she pretends to better her income, and also her quality of life. She is a new client that wishes to work with Prisma and Kiva. 

Her dream is to have a good, well-replenished business, and within a few years in the future, to travel to the United States to visit her children who are in that country. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras – May 2014.

loans.use: To buy products to replenish her small grocery store, such as chicken, rice, corn flour, lard, soaps, fresh produce etc.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en: Elsie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing net. Elsie has been in this business for two years now. In the future, she would like to save money to have her own business and enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net

loans.name: Belleza

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Belleza works hard to support her family.

She has a retail coconut business in the Philippines, and earns additional income farming sugarcane. Belleza requests 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more coconuts to sell.

Belleza has sustained her business activities through 7 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream which is to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more coconuts.l

loans.name: Gene

texts.en:
Gene is 45 years old and married with five children.

Gene works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested 18,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional  sanitary pads, soft-drinks, biscuits, shampoo, fabric conditioner, and cooking oil.

Gene has borrowed and repaid 4 previous loans from NWTF. She run the general store for 30 years and earns an income from fish vending.

Gene aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of sanitary pads, soft-drinks, biscuits, shampoo, fabric conditioner, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She requests 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Lorna has been in this business for 10 years and earns additional income from buying and selling clothing.

Lorna has sustained her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase materials like paint, wood, bamboo, etc. for the maintenance of her pumpboat. She has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Lorna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials like paint, wood, bamboo, etc. for the maintenance of her pumpboat

loans.name: Amro

texts.en:
Amro is a 21-year-old single man from Jaba, a small village near Jenin city. He lives with his family in a small house. His father is a worker and gets a low income, which barely covers all the family needs.

Amro is a university student studying business administration. He took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the university installments for this semester. By taking this loan, Amro will be able to complete his studies and find a job in the future.

Amro appears in the photo

loans.use: to pay his university installments.

loans.name: Mayra Lizzeth

texts.es:
La señora Mayra de  36  años de edad,  tiene tres  hijos que dependen de ella, vive con su esposo, radica en la comunidad de san Lorenzo  al sur de Honduras, y se dedica desde hace 02 años  al negocio de venta de minutas, bisutería como prendedores para pelo de mujer, piñatas, zapatitos de niño hechos de hilo, gorros de lana,  también desea comprar azúcar etc. Es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que desea salir adelante. 
Doña Mayra esta solicitando el préstamo para la compra de materia prima, para elaborar las piñatas y los adornos como papel, alambre, cartón, piedras, ojos de plástico y otros materiales para su negocio, es un cliente que solicita por primera vez el crédito a prisma y Kiva. Con el apoyo del crédito  ella pretende ampliar su negocio y por ende tener mejores ganancias. 
Ella Su sueño es mejorar su casa.
San Lorenzo, honduras - Mayo del 2014.
texts.en:
Mayra is 36 years old and has three children who depend on her. She lives with her husband in the community of San Lorenzo, in southern Honduras. For the past two years she has been working selling shaved ice, accessories like hair barrettes, pinatas, children's booties, knit caps, etc. She is a hardworking and enterprising woman who wants to get ahead.

Mayra is requesting this loan to buy supplies to make pinatas and decorations: paper, wire, cardboard, rhinestones, plastic eyes, and other items for her business. She also wants to buy sugar, etc. This client is requesting a loan from Prisma and Kiva for the first time. She wants to use the loan to expand her business in order to improve her income. 

Her dream is to improve her home.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - May, 2014

loans.use: to buy supplies for making pinatas and decorations.

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.es:
Cesar es un humilde mecánico el cual ha dado toda su vida a favor de sus 5 hijos ya que los saco adelante solo sin ayuda de la madre, sus conocimientos los aprendió empíricamente y gracias al sudor de su frente ha podido montar un negocio y establecerse como un icono en el barrio siendo sus servicios muy solicitados ya que sabe de qué manera arrancar un problema mecánico de raíz pero como toda persona siempre tiene sed de progreso, de auto mejorar ya que si su empresa aumenta las ventas los principales beneficiados serán sus hijos. 
Solicita un crédito para la compra de herramientas, y artículos para vender en su punto de venta  pues su única es meta es consolidar su negocio en este difícil y competitivo mundo de la mecánica y el crédito será un paso muy importante para sus proyectos.
texts.en:
Cesar is a humble mechanic who has dedicated his life to his 5 children who he supports without their mother's help. He learned his trade through experience and the sweat of his brow. He started his business and established himself as an pillar for his neighborhood. His services are sought after because he knows how to nip a mechanical problem in the bud. But, as anyone, he thirsts for progress to improve himself because if his business increases sales, the main beneficiaries are his children. 
He is requesting a loan for the purchase of tools and items to sell in his shop. His only goal is to strengthen his business in this tough and competitive world of mechanics. The loan will be an important step for his projects.

loans.use: to purchase tools and supplies to repair automobiles

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is 37 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm supplies. She has been farming rice for six years and also earns additional income from buying and selling bananas.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Susan is 40 years old and four of her children are currently in school.
Susan has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Susan requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.
Susan has been in this business for four years. In the future, Susan would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 57 years old and married, with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional household goods to sell, like canned goods, eggs, milk, and sugar.

Josephine has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from food-vending.

She aspires to save enough money to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional household goods to sell, like canned goods, eggs, milk, and sugar.

loans.name: Otilia Del Carmen

texts.es: Otilia es una mujer trabajadora que con sacrificios propios ha salido adelante, toda su vida se ha dedicado a las actividades del campo como es la ganadería y la Agricultura, junto a su esposo procrearon 6 hijos que ahora son mayores de edad y trabajan por si solos, Doña Otilia con la ayuda de su esposo plantó manzana y media de Cacao, la que necesita darle mantenimiento para obtener una excelente cosecha, ella solicita crédito para comprar Fertilizantes, productos agroquimicos, abono orgánico, pagar mano de obra y así poder obtener mejores resultados en su cosecha de cacao, sus ingresos en su mayoría provienen de la venta de leche y tubérculos ya que por ser una zona fresca las tierras son productivas y en esta temporada lluviosa desea aprovechar mas aun con la cosecha de Cacao, para ello es de suma importancia el crédito que seria una inversión que le dará resultados futuros.
texts.en: Otilia is a hardworking woman who has progressed through her own sacrifices. Her whole life she has been devoted to activities in the fields such as raising livestock and agriculture. Her husband fathered 6 children who are now adults and work for themselves. Otilia, with the help of her husband, planted a manzana and a half [approximately two and a half acres] of cacao. She needs to grow a bumper crop so  she has requested a loan to buy fertilizers, agrochemicals, organic fertilizer, to pay for labor, and, thereby, obtain better results in her cacao harvest. Her income comes mostly from the sale of milk and tubers as lands are productive in this cool area. In this rainy season, she wants to grow even more cacao. It is of utmost importance that her loan is an investment that gives future results.

loans.use: to plant cacao

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sheet metal and purlins.

loans.name: Jeremías 33:3 Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario lo integran tres socias laboriosas, y lo coordina la señora Yadira de 63 años de edad, viuda y madre de un hijo, es propietaria de un taller de costura y distribuye su producción en el mercado de la municipalidad, por diecisiete años se ha dedicado a este negocio y es el primer ciclo que solicita crédito esta socia, con el fin de invertir en tela, hilos, cola de ratón, entretela, zipper, etc., con esta inversión mejorará sus ingresos porque le permitirá comprar al por mayor y así sus ganancias aumentan. Las otras socias son las señoras Eris de 27 años de edad propietaria de una pulpería en su domicilio, y María Auxiliadora de 44 años de edad comerciante de verduras en el mercado de granada.
texts.en:
The solidarity group consists of three laborious members. Mrs. Yadira, a 63-year-old widow and mother to one son, coordinates the group. She is the owner of a sewing workshop and she distributes her products in the municipality’s market. For seventeen years she has been devoted to this business, and this is the first time that she is requesting a loan in order to invest in fabric, yarns, nylon thread, interlining, zippers etc. With this investment she will improve her income because it will allow her to buy wholesale, and that way her earnings will increase. 

The other members are Mrs. Eris, 27 years old and owner of a small grocery store at home; and María Auxiliadora, 44 years old and a vegetable merchant at the Granada market.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics, yarns, interlining, nylon thread, zippers etc.

loans.name: Connie

texts.en:
Connie is 31 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Connie is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase new rice seeds, pay for laborers' salaries in farm preparation, and buy fertilizers.

Connie has been farming rice for 6 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase new rice seeds, pay for laborers' salaries in farm preparation and buy fertilizers

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business. She has been in this business for five years. She earns more income from raising pigs.

Roselyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
At the age of 57, Kim is a hardworking farmer on a small rice field by her house. Kim lives in Phnum Kravanh District of Pursat Province, and she has two unmarried children and three married children. Being a farmer, which is the main source of her income, allows her to make about USD 3.00 per day.

Kim wants to promote her family's living condition and health care by having a latrine in her house, but she doesn't have enough money to afford a good one. For this reason, Kim is requesting a loan from Kiva to build a hygienic latrine for the sake for her family members. Kim hopes that this soon-coming latrine will give her a comfortable life and help maintain a good environment around her house.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
This is 39 year-old Theresa.  She is married and she has 4 children aged between 5 and 18 years. 

In 2002, Theresa established her bar/cold drinks business. She began her business because there was no employment for her as a trained nurse. Working 7 days a week and 7 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,000,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000. Theresa requires a loan in order to buy drinks of different kinds for resale. In the future, Theresa plans to build a bigger shop, to open a restaurant, to generate more income, to educate her children up to university level, and to expand her business. She is very hardworking. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy drinks of different kinds for resale

loans.name: Mary Lou

texts.en:
Meryl Zaira is 17 years old and is the second of two children in the family. Her mother Mary Lou supports the family through the business of raising pigs in the Philippines.

Meryl Zaira is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Secondary Education and is currently on the first of this four-year course.

Mary Lou, Meryl Zaira's mother, is borrowing 6,500 PHP to pay for tuition fees for the first semester of the school year 2014-15.

Meryl Zaira plans to graduate and be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Mariana

texts.en:
Mariana is a 43-year-old married woman with eight children, four of whom are currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Mariana has a broom-making business in the Philippines. Mariana requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more materials like bamboo, rope, wire, etc. for her business.

Mariana has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, Mariana would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more materials like bamboo, rope, wire, etc. for her business

loans.name: Manal

texts.en: Manal is a very responsible and active young woman. She works very hard in order to improve the living standards of her family. Last year, Manal applied for her first loan from Kiva lenders to purchase home appliances for her house. The first loan helped Manal very much to improve the living standards of her family. After Manal finished the repayment of the installment of the first loan, Manal applied for a second loan of 100,000 YER from Kiva lenders to purchase construction materials in order to renovate her house from the inside. She is waiting for a second loan from Kiva lenders in order to further improve the lives of her family.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials in order to renovate her house from the inside

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en:
Jamal is a 30-year-old married man with two children. His eldest child is six years old and the second one is three years old. He lives with them in Sana'a, Yemen. He studied through elementary school, but he couldn't complete his studies. Recently he was an employee in the public sector. Also, he has a mill used to grind grains. He is a talented and responsible professional man. He is very determined, inside himself, to go ahead. 

Jamal wants to improve the living standards of his family through purchasing a taxi, in order to work by it and to save money for his children. For this reason, Jamal is requesting a loan of 500,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase a taxi that will help him improve the living conditions of his family. 

Jamal hopes to build his own house to save the money that he is paying for renting.

loans.use: to purchase a taxi

loans.name: Los Chocoyitos Group

texts.es: Al grupo lo solidario lo integran tres socias laboriosas, y lo coordina la señora Araceli de 30 años de edad, acompañada y madre de tres hijos, quienes son su motivación para su superación, es propietaria de una mini pulpería en su domicilio y cuenta con el apoyo financiero de su compañero de vida y de sus hijos en la compra y venta de los productos, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de granos básicos como es arroz, frijoles, aceite, salsa de tomate, pan, chiverías, variedad de pastillas, sopas maggui, marucham, etc., una de sus metas es ampliar su negocio para obtener mayores ganancias. Otra de las socias es la señora Socorro de 48 años de edad, propietaria de una pulpería, además comercializa ropa de segunda, este negocio lo impulso hace veinte años, y la señora Nora de 62 años, dedicada al destace de cerdo desde hace quince años.
texts.en:
Three hardworking members make up this solidarity group. Araceli, who is thirty years old, coordinates it. She lives with her partner and is a mother of three children, who are her main source of motivation and drive. She owns a small grocery store located in her home and has her life partner's financial support as well as her children's in buying and selling her products.

She is requesting this loan to buy basic grains like rice and beans, oil, tomato sauce, bread, dairy products, assorted buillon cubes of different brands,etc. One of her goals is to expand her business in order to increase her earnings. 

Socorro is another of the members of this group. She is 48 years old and owns another grocery store. She also sells used clothing, a business that she started twenty years ago. Nora is 62 and has been butchering pigs for fifteen years.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil, tomato sauce, bread, dairy products, buillon cubes, etc.

loans.name: Nelita

texts.en:
Mary Joy is 19 years old and is the fifth of seven children in the family. Her mother Nelita supports the family through her general store business in the Philippines.

Mary Joy is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Secondary Education and is currently on the first of this four-year course.

Nelita, Mary Joy's mother, is borrowing 6,335 PHP to pay for tuition fees for the first semester of the school year 2014-15.

Mary Joy plans to graduate and be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Mujeres Al Progreso Group

texts.es: El grupo “MUJERES AL PROGRESO” se encuentra conformada por socias dedicadas a prestar servicios y al comercio minorista. Gloria tiene  58 años de edad es soltera dedicada a la venta de productos de belleza y lencería a través de catálogos hace muchos años. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de más lencería y productos de belleza que estén en oferta para expenderlos a un precio que le genere ganancias. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado.  Gloria es la primera del lado izquierdo viste chompa crema.  Y de la misma manera se encuentra se encuentra adjuntado la foto de Teodoro en la parte superior izquierdo que no pudo estar presente en la reunión.
texts.en:
The group “Mujeres al Progreso” (Women in Progress) consists of dedicated members who provide services and operate small businesses.
