Gloria is 58 years old and single. She has been selling beauty products and lingerie through catalogs for many years. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of more lingerie and beauty products so that she can sell them at a price that generates a profit.

This group is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the loan being offered. Gloria is the first person standing on the left wearing a cream-colored sweater. There is also a small photo in the upper left-hand corner of Teodoro, who was not able to be present at the meeting.

loans.use: to buy beauty products and lingerie.

loans.name: Marvin

texts.es: Marvin es una persona honrada y muy trabajadora, con su propio sacrificio se ha convertido en un buen agricultor, generando un activo muy importante como es su propiedad, la cual trabajada con sus propias manos. Marvin desde muy niño se ha dedicado a la agricultura y la ganadería, se siente muy contento con esta labor, ya que es su principal fuente de ingreso.  Con el ánimo de obtener mayores ingresos y mejorar sus condiciones de vida solicita crédito para el establecimiento y mantenimiento de una manzana de cacao, para ello necesita comprar productos agroquímicos, insumos orgánicos, semillas de plátanos que serán las que darán sombra, y pago de mano de obra; de esta manera podrá obtener una buena producción de cacao.  Su esposa se dedica a las actividades del hogar y sus 4 hijos son mayores de edad y trabajan en conjunto con don Marvin.
texts.en:
Marvin is an honest and very hard-working person who with his own personal sacrifices has become a good farmer, generating a very important asset in his property, which he works with his own hands.

From a young age, Marvin has worked in agriculture and farming; he is very happy with this type of work as it is his primary source of income.

With the hopes of obtaining higher returns and improving his living conditions, he is asking for a loan to set up and maintain 1.74 acres (one manzana) of cacao. He needs to buy agrochemicals, organic fertilizers, banana seeds that will give the cacao shade and to pay for labor. With these purchases, he can produce a good crop of cacao.
 
His wife takes care of the home and their four children are grown-up and work with Marvin.

loans.use: to set up and maintain cacao crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy iron equipment for his workshop

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is 48 years old and married with three children.

Teodora works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items such as creamer, coffee, sugar, soft-drinks, beers, soy sauce, juice, etc. to sell.

Teodora has borrowed and paid back one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Teodora aspires to save enough money so that she will be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items such as creamer, coffee, sugar, soft-drinks, beers, soy sauce, juice, etc. to sell

loans.name: Fredeswinda

texts.en:
Ritze is 19 years old and is fourth of nine children in the family. Her mother Fredeswinda supports the family through her general store business in the Philippines.

Ritze is studying for the bachelor of science in computer science and is currently in her third year of this four-year course. Fredeswinda, Ritze's mother is borrowing PHP 6,000 to pay tuition fees of the first semester of the school year 2014-15.

When she graduates, Ritze plans to to raise up the family from poverty.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees

loans.name: Ana Marie

texts.en:
Ana Marie is 30 years old and married with two children. 

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. Ana Marie has been in pig fattening for three years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva, to sustain her business.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Flor Marina

texts.es: Flor, tiene 30 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene una hija de 10 años con quien vive en un sector del municipio de San Pedro Sula. Siempre ha buscado obtener ingresos, anteriormente vendía tortillas y hace 3 años decidió establecer una pulpería donde vende arroz, frijoles, harina, bananos, papas, verduras, refrescos churros, condimentos, dulces, productos de higiene etc.  El préstamo que solicita es por 9,000 lempiras, con el cual va comprar variedad como ser carnes, productos lácteos, embutidos y condimentos. Esta inversión le ayudara a incrementar ventas y clientes y a comprar solo de contado.
texts.en:
Flor, 30, is a single mother of a 10 year-old daughter and they live in a part of the municipality of San Pedro Sula. She has always searched for ways to generate an income; before she sold tortillas and for the last three years she has run a small market that she started and where she sells rice, beans, flour, bananas, potatoes, vegetables, drinks, churros, condiments, sweets, hygiene products and more. 

The loan that she is asking for is for 9,000 lempiras, which she will use to buy a variety of products such as meat, dairy products, sausages and condiments. This investment will help her increase sales, clients and buy items in cash.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products such as meat, diary products, sausages and condiments to sell.

loans.name: Nicefora

texts.en:
Nicefora is 61 years old and has five children. She is married and four of her children are still in school.

Nicefora is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. She has been in pig fattening for 10 years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. Nicefora has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her business.

In the future, Nicefora would like to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her business fattening pigs

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina is a married woman with six children. She is 48 years old and two of her children are currently in school. Carolina is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Carolina has a business raising livestock in the Philippines and she has been in this business for five years. Carolina requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock and other supplies for her business.

In the future, Carolina would like to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy two live pigs.

loans.name: Luis Miguel

texts.es:
Luis es un joven emprendedor, tiene 29 años de edad, es soltero, tiene un pequeño hijo y vive en San Juan de Lurigancho junto a su familia.
Desde hace más de 3 años trabaja como Estibador y le va muy bien porque es una persona persistente, dedicada a su labor, responsable y con muchas ganas de salir adelante sobre todo por su hijo, quien es su mayor motivación para seguir luchando.
Luis está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá remodelar el piso de la casa de su madre ya que se encuentra en malas condiciones y quiere mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Luis is a young entrepreneur who is 29 years of age and single. He has a young son and lives with his family in San Juan de Lurigancho.

For more than three years, Luis has been a dock worker. He is doing very well because he is a persistent individual who is devoted to his job. Luis is also responsible and has the drive to succeed. Above all else, his son provides him the greatest motivation to continue pressing forward.

Luis is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because of the assistance they have offered. He will be able to repair the floor of his mother’s house since it is in bad condition. Luis wants to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to repair the floor of his mother's house.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is 24 years old and married, with three children.

She earns a living by having a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Concepcion is borrowing PHP 10,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Concepcion has been in pig-fattening for two years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is single and has a business raising livestock in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years now.

Marivic requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock, feed, etc. for her business. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock, feed, etc. for her business

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is single and has a business raising livestock in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years now.

Gemma requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed, vitamins, and vaccines for her livestock. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins, and vaccines for her livestock

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.en:
Fortunata is 48 years old and married with four children. She is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Fortunata has been raising livestock for five years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Fortunata requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her livestock. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her livestock

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 44 years old and married with seven children. She works hard to provide for her family. Lorna runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like soft drinks, cereals, milk, juice, detergent soap, shampoo, and other groceries to sell.

Lorna has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for five years and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Lorna aspires to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like soft drinks, cereals, milk, juice, detergent soap, shampoo, and other groceries to sell

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Marianne is 18 years old and is second of four children in the family. Her mother Virginia supports the family through her general store business in the Philippines.

Marianne is studying for the bachelor of science in business administration and is currently in her second year of this four-year course. Virginia, Marianne's mother is borrowing PHP 8,000 to pay for tuition fees of the first semester of the school year 2014-15.

Marianne plans to graduate and be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Vilma has been in this business for one year. Vilma earns additional income from pig fattening.

Vilma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Gracilda

texts.en:
Gracilda is 52 years old and has four children. She is married and one of her children is still in school. Gracilda is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She has been raising livestock for five years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Gracilda requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vaccines and vitamins for her livestock. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines, and vitamins for her livestock

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher used his previous loan to buy a piece of land for farming. He is still in the business of transport and is facing challenges of limited capital and bad roads. However, he dreams of buying another motorcycle, which would enable him to increase his income.

Christopher needs a loan to buy tires and pay for general repairs.

loans.use: to buy tires and pay for general repairs.

loans.name: Ledys Del Rosario

texts.es: Las verdaderas habilidades de una persona surgen cuando esta se ve llevada a un caso tan extremo que solo tiene suspiro para actuar y este caso encaja perfectamente con la situación de Ledys una mujer de 42 años de edad que ante su inminente separación se vio en la obligación de buscar alternativas para poder mantener a su hija ya que sabía que no podría esperar nada de su esposo, Ledys trabaja en una empresa pero sus ingresos no le son suficientes para mantener su hogar y es por esta razón y con ayuda de una tía comenzara a vender productos congelados con los cuales tiene la fe de poder obtener recursos suficientes para vivir cómodamente con su hija pero como persona humilde no cuenta con el capital para iniciar su negocio y es por esta razón que requiere una ayuda crediticia para la compra de una estufa industrial con la que empezara a cocer su futuro para ella y su hija.
texts.en:
A person's true abilities come out when pushed to such an extreme that they only have breath left to act. This perfectly describes the situation with Ledys, a 42-year old woman who, faced with her imminent separation, felt obligated to look for alternatives to be able to support her daughter, since she knew that she couldn't expect anything from her husband.

Ledys works at a private company, but her income is not enough to maintain her home. This is why, with the help of an aunt, she will start selling frozen foods. She has faith that with these, she will be able to get enough resources to live comfortably with her daughter. However, as a person of modest means, she doesn't have the capital to start her business. That is why she needs the help of a loan to buy an industrial stove, with which she will begin to cook her and her daughter's future.

loans.use: to buy an industrial stove to start her business, in search of a better future for herself and her daughter.

loans.name: Altynhan

texts.ru: Алтынхан 51 год, замужем, мать 5 детей. Успешно работая в сфере животноводства и полеводства Алтынхан добилась очень хороших результатов, у нее есть 1 корова, 1 теленок, 1 бычок, 6 овец, также имеется земельный надел мерою 2,30 ГА, где Алтынхан выращивает кукурузу, что позволяет ей обеспечивать кормом свой скот и иметь дополнительный доход от реализации кукурузы. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS). Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Алтынхан обратилась в Банк «Бай - Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS) на покупку минеральных удобрений, ядохимикатов и проведения культивации земли. На прибыль от кредита Алтынхан планирует увеличить своё хозяйство. Она поделилась, что в будущем планирует женить младшего сына и обеспечить его собственным жильем.
texts.en: Altynhan is 51, married, and the mother of five children. She has been successful in her agricultural work and currently has a cow, a calf, a bull, six sheep and 2.30 hectares of land where she grows corn to sell for additional income and to use for cattle feed. She earns around 10,000 som (KGS) per month. In order to expand her business, she applied for a loan with the bank Bai-Tushum for 25,000 som (KGS) to use for purchasing mineral fertilizers and pesticides for developing the land. She plans to use the profits from the loan to expand her farm. She shared with us that her youngest son is planning to get married and she intends to make sure he will have his own home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase furniture for his house.

loans.name: Eduardo Jose

texts.es: Eduardo se presenta nuevamente a AFODENIC a solicitar crédito de Fondos Kiva, en esta ocasión con el objetivo de invertirlo en el establecimiento de un manzana de cacao, él necesita comprar algunas herramientas de trabajo,insumos como semilla, bolsas, abono orgánico y realizar el pago de la mano de obra para siembra, él desea aprovechar un pedazo de terreno que su papá le ha asignado para que trabaje y obtenga sus propios ingresos, está agradecido con su padre y se siente comprometido con el por lo que comparten los gastos del hogar ya q habitan en la misma casa, ademas se encarga de los trabajos de su padre en la propiedad. Eduardo desea también  aprovechar el clima fresco en estos meses de invierno donde el suelo es mas productivo, con su basta experiencia en la Agricultura y Ganadería está seguro de poder aplicar las técnicas de mejoras al cultivo y al mantenimiento de su hato ganadero, los cuales son sus principales fuentes de ingresos.  A pesar que es un hombre soltero es una persona muy responsable y progresivo, cada día se esfuerza por mantener su unidad de trabajo en buenas condiciones y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Eduardo has come back to AFODENIC to ask for a loan from Fondo Kiva. This time he is asking for this loan to invest in setting up 1.74 acres (1 manzana) of cacao. For this he will need to buy some work tools, supplies such as seeds, bags, organic fertilizers and to pay for the labor of planting the crops. 
He wants to take advantage of a piece of land that his father has given him to work and create his own source of income. He is thankful to his father and he is committed to share the responsibility for the household expenses as they live in the same house. He also is in charge of his dad’s jobs around the property. 
Eduardo also wants to take advantage of the cool weather in these months of winter when the soil is most productive. With enough experience in agriculture and farming, he is sure that he can apply the best practices to the cultivation and maintenance of his livestock herd, which is his main source of income.
Although he is single, he is a very responsible and progressive person and every day he works hard to maintain his work in good conditions and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to set up cacao crops.

loans.name: Na Tau 6 Group

texts.en:
Thin, 31, is a Thai woman who is married and has two children, one in grade 6 and the other in grade 9. She and her family live in a small, traditional Thai house and mostly earn a living through agricultural activities such as cultivating rice, planting vegetables, and breeding chickens and fish. However, because of a lack of land, it is hard for Thin to expand her farming, so she has opened a grocery store and her husband works extra for a local construction employer. 

In spite of their constant efforts, their income is only enough to cover their family's basic living expenses and tuition fees for their children.  Thin cannot afford to buy new furniture for her house or books or toys for her children. This has motivated her to carry out a pig-raising project and, to do that, she has taken out a loan from Anh Chi Em Program to buy piglets. She said that she joined in the Program's services not only because of the loan, but also due to the useful training she would receive, which she heard about through the introduction from Anh Chi Em staff. This is Thin's first loan in the Program and she hopes that with this project, she can make her family richer and can progressively improve their living standards.

In the picture, Thin wears a yellow shirt and stands first from the right.

loans.use: to buy piglets

loans.name: Janina Ysabel

texts.es:
Janina es una mujer emprendedora, tiene 37 años de edad, es soltera, tiene 2 hijos y vive en el Distrito de Imperial junto a su familia.
Al ser madre soltera tuvo que buscar la manera de salir adelante sola, y eso no fue un impedimento para que sobresaliera. Desde hace más de 5 años tiene una bodega con la que trabaja y con la que solventa los gastos familiares. Le va muy bien porque es una persona con muchos deseos de superación, dedicada a su trabajo, responsable y obre todo porque tiene como mayor motivación a sus hijos.
Janina está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería para suministrar la bodega y así tenga productos variados que ofrecer, de esta manera obtendrá mayores ingresos y con el dinero ahorrado podrá cumplir una de sus más grandes metas: "Ampliar su vivienda".
texts.en:
Janina is an entrepreneurial woman. She is 37 years old and single. She has 2 children, and lives in the Imperial District with her family.

Being a single mother, she had to look for a way to get ahead alone, and this did not stand in her way. For more than 5 years, she has had a grocery store with which she works and covers family expenses. It is going very well for her, because she is a person with a great desire to get ahead. She is dedicated to her work, responsible, and above all, she has her children as her greatest motivation.

Janina is grateful to Kiva lenders, because with the support they have provided, she will be able to buy merchandise to stock her grocery store, and thus have a variety of products to offer. In this way, she will get greater earnings, and with the money saved, she will be able to achieve one of her greatest goals: "To expand her house."

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her grocery store.

loans.name: María Ana De Jesus

texts.es: María tiene 53 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su hijo y dos nietos. María se dedica a la elaboración de dulces de forma artesanal desde hace mucho tiempo. La venta la hace de forma ambulante y de esta forma lleva el sustento a su hogar y logra mantener la economía de su familia. María solicita este crédito a FUSAI dado que desea construir un corredor en su vivienda y además desea encementar el piso que actualmente es de tierra. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, arena, lámina y madera.
texts.en:
Maria, 53, lives in her own home with her son and two grand-children. She has worked for a long time making artisanal sweets. She sells her sweets door-to-door and with this income she takes care of her household and is able to maintain the family’s economic needs.
Maria is asking for this loan from FUSAI because she wants to build a corridor in her home and set a concrete floor as it is currently dirt. With the loan she will buy cement, sand, sheet metal and wood.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, sheet metal, and wood to build a corridor in her home.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
El señor  MIGUEL de 36 años de edad  es  casado y vive con su esposa en su casa de habitación donde se dedica ala  elaboración de lácteos, rosquillas, este producto lo vende en las diferentes aldeas vecinas en su casa de habitación, vende lo que es rosquitas, queso mantequilla, cuajada, y quesillo, se dedica a su micro empresa desde hace 10 años , su cliente son de su aldea, pero la mayor parte de cliente son  de diferentes lugares aledaño, ya que cada día por las tardes sale en su vehículo a ofrecer su producto por las diferentes aldeas y caserío, su negocio esta ubicado en aldea el pedrerito la sur de Honduras.
Don MIGUEL está solicitando 10, 000.00  lempiras para compra  de leche para elaborara lácteos. Y Con las ganancias y el apoyo de este préstamo  Don miguel  desea salir adelante y seguir mejorando sus ingresos.
Su sueño es crecer más en su micro empresa y generar fuente de trabajo.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Mayo del 2014.
texts.en:
Miguel, 36 years old, is married and lives with his wife in their home where he produces dairy products and doughnuts. He sells these products in the villages near his home. He sells doughnuts, butter, cottage cheese and cheese curds, and he has made a living from his small business for the past ten years. Some of his clients are in his village, but the majority live in the surrounding villages, and so every afternoon he goes out in his vehicle to sell his products in the surrounding villages and hamlets. His business is located in the village El Pedrerito in the south of Honduras.

Don Miguel is requesting a loan of 10,000 lempiras to buy milk to make his dairy products. With his savings and the support of this loan, Don Miguel hopes go further and continue to increase his income. His dreams are to grow his small business and to gain new sources of work.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – May, 2014

loans.use: to buy milk to produce dairy products for his business.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: Roberto, tiene 33 años de edad, es casado, tiene una hija y vive en el municipio de Morazán, Yoro. Hace cuatro años inicio su propio negocio de venta de accesorios para celulares como forros, focos de mano, lentes, fajas, relojes, controles, carteras, etc.  Este negocio lo realiza de manera ambulante en la comunidad. El préstamo que solicita es el tercer ciclo y es por 10,000 lempiras con el cual va comprar achinería como lentes, focos, relojes de mano, fajas, carteras y otros. Su objetivo es incrementar las ventas y las ganancias para apoyar a su esposa y a su hija con la educación.
texts.en:
Roberto is 33 years old, married, and has a daughter. He lives in the town of Morazán, Yoro.

Four years ago, Roberto started his own business of selling mobile phone accessories including covers, pocket flashlights, sunglasses, belts, watches, controls, wallets, and other products. He conducts his business as a street vendor in his community. The loan he is requesting is his third one and is in the amount of 10,000 HNL. Roberto will use the money to buy merchandise such as sunglasses, flashlights, wristwatches, belts, wallets, and other items.

His goal is to increase his sales and his earnings so that he can support his wife and his daughter with her education.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as sunglasses, flashlights, wristwatches, belts, wallets, and other items.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha works hard to support her family. Editha is married and has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines.

Editha requested an 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell at her vegetable stall.

Editha has been in this business for 6 years now and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

In the future, Editha would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell at her vegetable stall

loans.name: Isiyaku Goma

texts.en: Isiyaku Goma is a 43-year-old farmer from R/Tabo. As a Babban Gona member, Isiyaku Goma, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Isiyaku Goma can earn up to $2,000/hectare this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the National average of 14. However, Isiyaku Goma is ambitious and is aiming to reap 70 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Isiyaku Goma said “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children Dauda, Istifanus,  and  Shezekiya, and in five years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high quality inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sausage cart.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is single and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Rose has been in this business for 3 years now.

Rose requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

In the future, Rose would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es: María tiene 37 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a sus dos hijos de 14 años y 12 años de edad. María es una mujer increíble quien trabaja como jornalera en una hacienda cercana a su localidad. Con el fin de mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales ha tomado la decisión de construir un cuarto dormitorio para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de los materiales necesarios como: ladrillo, arena, cemento, hierro, etc. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así dar inicio a la construcción lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Maria, 37, lives in her own house with her two sons, one is 14 and the other is 12. She is an incredible women who works as a day laborer on a farm near her home. 

With the hopes of improving her daily conditions, she has made the decision to build a bedroom. For this reason she has asked for a loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of necessary materials such as brick, sand, cement, metal, etc. She hopes to receive this financing so that she will be able to begin the construction as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy brick, sand, cement, metal, etc to build a room.

loans.name: Waren

texts.en:
Waren is 25 years old and married with one child.

Waren works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Waren has borrowed and paid back 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

Waren aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.en:
Jeffrey is 16 years old and is the second of four children in his family. His mother, Ana Maria, supports the family through her general store business in the Philippines.

Jeffrey is studying Information Technology and is currently in his first year of this 4-year course.

Ana Maria, Jeffrey's mother, is borrowing 7,285 PHP to pay for tuition fees for the first semester of the 2014-2015 school year.

Jeffrey plans to be gainfully employed so that he can help to improve the quality of life of his family.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Cyril John is 18 years old and is the tenth of twelve children in his family. His mother, Julieta, supports the family through her food vending business in the Philippines.

Cyril John is studying Information Technology and is currently in his second year of this 4-year course.

Julieta, Cyril John's mother, is borrowing 7,000 PHP to pay for tuition fees for the first semester of the 2014-2015 school year.

When he graduates, Cyril John plans to graduate and be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna has a live-in partner with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Myrna is 42 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Myrna has a business selling purified drinking water in the Philippines. Myrna requested a 10,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) loan amount through NWTF to buy more containers of purified drinking water to sell.

Myrna has been in this business for one year. In the future, Myrna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more containers of purified drinking water to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs

loans.name: Marizel

texts.en:
Marizel is 42 years old and married, with two children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Marizel is borrowing PHP 10,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional livestock for her business.

Marizel has been raising livestock for five years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock for her business.

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice is 29 years old, married, and has four children who are in school.

Janice is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Janice has been in the pig fattening business for one year now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Janice would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 51 years old and married.

Elizabeth works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy more groceries like canned goods, cooking oil, coffee, sugar, cereals, soft-drinks, and other items to sell.

Elizabeth has borrowed and paid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Elizabeth aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries like canned goods, cooking oil, coffee, sugar, cereals, soft-drinks, and other items to sell

loans.name: Zoila Amparo

texts.es: Amparo recide en una Provincia que se caracteriza por ser productiva y ganadera, Amparo se dedica a la crianza de animales, Amparo vive  con su esposo y sus 4  hijos de 2, 7, 9 y 11 años de los cuales los 3 mayores estan estudiando, ella se dedica desde hace 3 años atrás a la criansa de chanchos asi que el credito lo va a invertir en la compr de dichos animales, su esposo se dedica al jornal de trabajo en el campo, Amparo espera seguir ayudando a su esposo en los gastos del hogar y asi que sus hijos tenga lo necesario para seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Amparo lives in a province that is known for its production and livestock. 
Amparo raises animals and lives with her husband and their four children of ages 2, 7, 9 and 11. 
The three oldest children study and for the last three years Amparo has worked raising pigs. 
The loan will be invested in the purchase of pigs. 
Her husband is a day worker in the fields and Ampara hopes to continue to help her husband with the household costs and assure that their children have what they need to continue studying.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Mohira

texts.ru: Мохира молодая жительница маленького района Кубадиен. Ей 29 лет у нее она воспитывает маленьких детей. Ее муж находится за приделами страны в Российской Федерации на заработках. Из-за отсутствия рабочих мест на районе он был вынужден уехать. Махира сама занимается воспитанием детей. Так же чтобы иметь дополнительный источник дохода, она во дворе выращивает крупнорогатых скотин. Она покупает маленького теленка и в течение определенного времени откармливает и перепродает с наценкой. С таким не хитрым способом она зарабатывает. Сейчас Мохире нужен кредит, чтобы купить корм для скота и еще теленка, она надеется на Вашу на оказание с Вашей стороны поддержку.
texts.en: Mohira is a young resident of the Qubadiyon district. She is 29 and has young children. Her husband was forced to leave because of a lack of jobs in the area and is now working in Russia. Mohira is raising the children alone. She keeps cattle in her yard to earn additional income. She will buy a small calf to fatten for a while before selling it for a profit. It is a straightforward way to earn money. Mohira now needs a loan in order to buy feed for cattle and a calf. She hopes for your support.

loans.use: to buy feed for cattle and a calf

loans.name: Effort De Catier Morin Group

texts.fr:
Benito est le coordinateur de son groupe Effort de Catier Morin. Il est marié, Il a 2 enfants. Il habite dans la région nord d`Haïti ou de électricité est rare et de l’eau portable est très limitee.

Benito va acheter les différents produits pour augmenter l'inventaire de votre entreprise. Avant de ce commercer ce commerce Il était un écolier. Il plan à acheter de divers produit avec chaussures et cosmetiques.

Des autres membres de EFFORT DE CATIER MORIN ont besoin d’un emprunt pour le commerce tel ques ventes produits de cosmétiques, boissons gazeuses etc. Il déclare que son défi principal est de devenir un grand commerçant dans le département du nord. Il dit son but principal c’est d’avoir un grand commerce qui lui facilitera à construire une grande enterprise avec l’aide d'Esperanza Int.
texts.en:
Benito is the coordinator of the Effort de Catier Morin group. He is married, and he has two children. He lives in the Northern region of Haiti, where electricity is scarce and drinking water is very limited.

Benito will buy different products to increase his stock. Before he began trading he attended school. He plans to buy various products including shoes and cosmetics. Other members of the Effort de Catier Morin group need a loan to trade products such as cosmetics, soft drinks, etc.

He says his biggest challenge is to become a great trader in the Northern region. His main goal is to build up a good trade business and make it easier to start a large company, with the help of Esperanza Int.

loans.use: buy shoes and cosmetics

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Junito Juntie is 23 years old and is the fifth of six children in the family. His mother Teresita, who is a member of NWTF, supports the family through her general store business in the Philippines.

Junito Juntie is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Criminology and is currently in the fourth of this 4-year course.

Teresita, Junito Juntie's mother, is borrowing 10,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) to pay for the tuition fees of the first semester of the 2014-2015 school year.

Junito Juntie plans to graduate and be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to open up a general store that will be stocked with dry food stuffs, such as rice, millet, and maize flour.

loans.name: Gabriel Bako

texts.en: Gabriel Bako is a 42-year-old farmer from Kankanki. As a Babban Gona member, Gabriel Bako is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Gabriel Bako can earn up to $2,000/hectare this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the National average of 14. However, Gabriel Bako is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Gabriel Bako said, “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children Maitala, Yahaya, and Isiyaku, and in five years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high quality inputs

loans.name: Indede

texts.en: Indede is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. He joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children Nuhu, Safayanu, and Aisha. Indede is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Indede will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products like sand. With access to high quality inputs, Indede can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14, and earn up to $2,000/hectare, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked, Indede said, “I plan to use the money I make this year to provide more food and clothing for my family.” Indede is not thinking about just this year; he said, “in five years, I want to make more money for myself and my family.”

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Milagro

texts.es:
La señora Milagro de 38 años de edad, vive con su conyugue  y sus tres  hijos tiene casa propia, se dedica desde hace 03 años al negocio de venta de repuestos para bicicleta en su taller ella repara y vende los repuestos de las mismas, su venta es con los amigos y personas que llegan a  diario a reparar sus bicicletas y para esta época de invierno ella vende bastante porque se dañan las misma, milagro es una mujer trabajadora  que lucha junto con sus esposo a mejorar su calidad de vida.
Doña Milagro está solicitando el préstamo para compra de repuestos como llantas de varios números, rines, neumáticos, accesorios, pedales, parchos, pepes, balineras y otros con el apoyo de este crédito ella pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es su segundo crédito que solicita a prisma y está muy contenta por el apoyo a su negocio 
Su sueño es mejorar su taller.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Mayo del 2014.
texts.en:
Milagro, 38, lives with her partner and their three children in their own home. For the last three years she has worked selling bicycle parts in her shop. She repairs bicycles and sells such parts to her clients who are friends and people that arrive every day to repair their bicycles. During the winter season she sells a lot because people damage their bikes more often. 

Milagro is a hard-working woman who works with her husband to improve their quality of life.

She is asking for a loan to buy parts such as tires of different sizes, wheels, accessories, pedals, patches, gears, bearings and other parts. With the help of this loan, Milagro aims to improve her family’s income and quality of life.

This is the second loan that she has requested from PRISMA and she is very happy for the help to her business. Her dream is to improve her shop.
San Lorenzo, Honduras- May 2014

loans.use: to buy parts such as tires, wheels, accessories, pedals, patches, gears, bearings and other parts for her business.

loans.name: Garba

texts.en: Garba is a 55-year-old farmer from Badamasi. As a Babban Gona member, Garba is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Garba can earn up to $2,000/hectare this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Garba is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Garba said, “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children Aliyu, Lawaldi, and Sefillshi, and in five years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high quality inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials to tile

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy condiments

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Doris es una mujer emprendedora, tiene 31 años de edad, es soltera y vive en Imperial junto a su familia. Tiene un hijo quien es su mayor inspiración en la vida y su motor para salir adelante. 
Desde hace casi 2 años tiene un pequeño Salón de Belleza y le va muy bien porque es una persona muy responsable, trabajadora y sobre todo sus clientes se encuentran fascinados con los consejos de belleza que les brinda.
Doris está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería para implementar el negocio así no solo será un salón de belleza sino también ofrecerá productos para el cuidado personal. Con esto, ella tendrá mayores ingresos que más adelante podrá utilizarlo para abrir más sucursales.
texts.en:
Doris is a hard working business woman. She is 31 years old, single, and lives in Imperial with her family. She has a son who is the biggest inspiration in her life, and her motivation to get ahead. 

She has owned a small beauty salon for almost 2 years, which has been going well for her: she is a responsible and hardworking person, and above all, her clients are fascinated with the beauty services and advice she provides. 

Doris is grateful to the Kiva lenders because, with their support, she will be able to purchase merchandise to transform her business into not only a beauty salon, but also a place that sells personal care products. With this, she will have a higher income which she will then be able to use to open more branches.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to sell in her beauty salon.

loans.name: Charilyn

texts.en:
Charilyn is a married woman, with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Charilyn is 26 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Charilyn has an abaca-weaving business in the Philippines. Charilyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more materials for her business, like abaca fiber.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Charilyn has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her business, like abaca fiber.

loans.name: Kwizera Group

texts.fr:
Rose   fait partie du groupe Kwizera  et  habite à Gitega. Elle a 30  ans et est mariée à Althemas, un cultivateur. Ensemble ils ont 2 enfants  qui étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de  poules et de bananes depuis 8 ans.

Elle est à son quatrième crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et  acheter beaucoup de poules et de bananes  à revendre, pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Rose is part of the Kwizera group and lives in Gitega. She is 30 years old and is married to Althemas, a farmer. Together they have two children who attend school. 

She has been trading chickens and bananas for the past eight years. 

This is her fourth credit loan with Turame. With the KIVA loan, she will increase her working capital and buy lots of hens and bananas for resale, to earn more.

loans.use: increase his working capital and buy a lot of chickens and bananas for resale, to earn more.

loans.name: Yusufu

texts.en: Yusufu is a 55-year-old farmer from Kankanki Badamasi.  As a Babban Gona member, Yusufu is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Yusufu can earn up to $2,000/hectare this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Yusufu is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money to educate my children. My overall goal is to become the most profitable farmer in my community”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving these goals.

loans.use: To purchase high quality inputs

loans.name: Rabiu

texts.en: Rabiu is a 35-year-old farmer from Kankanki Badamasi.  As a Babban Gona member, Rabiu is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Rabiu can earn up to $2,000/hectare this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Rabiu is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money to educate my children Shafi, Adulmalic, and Zaarau. My overall goal is to become the most profitable farmer in my community”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving these goals.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs

loans.name: Ritha Guadalupe

texts.es: Guadalupe es casada y vive con sus 5 hijos de 3, 5, 9, 12, y 14 años de edad de los cuales 4 se encuentran estudiando, Guadalupe se dedica a la ganaderia y a la criana de animales, el esposo de ella se dedica ala agricultura, Guadalupe este credito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos, Guadalupe aspira seguir adelante en su negocio para ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar ya que darle la educacion a todos sus hijos es un gasto fuerte y Guadalupe dice que si podra sacar adelante y educar  a sus hijos para que ellos tengan un buen futuro.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is married and lives with her 5 children aged 3, 5, 9, 12, and 14 years-old, four of which are in school. Guadalupe is a rancher and rears animals, and her husband is a farmer. Guadalupe will invest this loan in the purchase of pigs. 

She aspires to continue her business to help her husband with the household expenses since giving an education to all her children is a large expense. Guadalupe says that she will be able to advance and educate her children so that they may have a good future.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia is 60 years old and married with eight children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Arsenia is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Arsenia has been farming vegetables for 30 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 46 years old, married and has four children, two of whom are currently in school.

Wilma is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional piglets, feed and other supplies for her business.

Wilma has been in pig fattening for two years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Wilma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets, feed and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Na Tau 7 Group

texts.en:
Hoa, 30, is a Thai woman who lives in a Thai traditional house with her husband and two children, ages 7 and 11, in a small village, far from the center of town. She works at an agricultural business that includes cultivating rice and breeding chickens, ducks and pigs, while her husband works as the teacher of a small village school. Their children attend school. 

Several months ago, some pigs that Hoa raised died because of disease. This is the first time she has taken out a loan from Anh Chi Em Program and she will use this loan to buy piglets and continue raising more pigs. She said that she heard a lot about the Program and she believed that, together with the training on breeding pigs from Anh Chi Em, she would be successful in raising and selling pigs, and her family's income would be increased. 

Hoa dreams her children will have a more abundant life, achieve good results from studying, take good jobs and escape from poverty. In the picture, she stands first from the right.

loans.use: to buy piglets.

loans.name: Adamu

texts.en: Adamu is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Adamu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children Aminu and Safariya. Adamu is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Adamu will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products such as sand. With access to high quality inputs, Adamu can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and earn up to $2,000/hectare, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make this year as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money to build a better home.” Adamu is not thinking about this year alone; he expressed that his long-term goal is to “become the most profitable farmer in my community”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed

loans.name: Ake

texts.en: Ake is a 43-year-old married mother of six children. She has a farming business, and she sells not only to the people of her community, but to the traveling public as well. She is assisted by her husband and children. Ake plans to use this loan for which she is applying to purchase a mist blower, chemicals, fertilizer, safety boots, bush knives, spades, and digging tools for her farming business. Ake joined the SPBD program in 2012, in order to gain access to financial assistance. She has managed to improve her family's living standards with the profits that she was able to earn from her sales.

loans.use: to purchase a mist blower, chemicals, fertilizer, safety boots, bush knives, spades, and digging tools for her business.

loans.name: Dimas Alexander

texts.es: Dimas tiene 24 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su grupo familiar. Dimas es un joven muy trabajador quien se dedica a la agricultura principalmente al cultivo de maíz y frijoles. De esta forma se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Dimas solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de una pila para lo cual necesita materiales como: arena, ladrillo, cemento, hierro, lámina y madera.
texts.en:
Dimas is 24 years old and lives in his own home together with his family. Dimas is a very hard working young man who is a farmer, mainly focusing on corn and beans. He makes a living this way and brings home sustenance. 

Dimas is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in the construction of a water basin for which he needs materials such as sand, brick, cement, iron, metal sheets, and wood.

loans.use: to buy sand, brick, cement, iron, metal sheets, and wood to build a water basin.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy zinc sheeting and perlines to repair his roof.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buy household appliances.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 59 years old and married with five children.

Editha works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Editha has borrowed and repaid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from food and banana vending.

Editha aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Apolinaria

texts.en:
Apolinaria is 65 years old and single. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Apolinaria has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Apolinaria requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her pig fattening business.

Apolinaria has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Apolinaria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra is a 52-year-old married woman with five children, two of whom are still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Alejandra has a direct selling Avon products business in the Philippines. Alejandra requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more products from Avon to sell to her customers.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Alejandra has been in this business for five years. In the future, Alejandra would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more products from Avon to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is married and for the past five years has worked hard selling fish in the Philippines. She successfully repaid a previous loan through NWTF and is now applying for a 15,000 PHP loan. She plans to use this toward building her fish-vending business. In this way she is working to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 55 years old and married with six children.

Elizabeth works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of goods, such as shampoo, coffee, detergent soap, canned goods, spices and noodles, for resale.

Elizabeth has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns income from selling personal accessories.

Elizabeth aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of goods, such as shampoo, coffee, detergent soap, canned goods, spices and noodles, for resale.

loans.name: Sule

texts.en:
Sule remembers the starvation his family faced  during a particularly bad harvest season. This is before he became a Babban Gona member. Now, as a Babban Gona member, Sule, like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 

The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Sule,  is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  Sule expressed that, “In five years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community.” With this loan, Sule is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double his yield and income

loans.name: Balarabe

texts.en:
Balarabe is a 40-year-old farmer from Badamasi. As a Babban Gona member, Balarabe is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Balarabe can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 

The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the national average of 14. However, Balarabe is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Balarabe said “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children: Habubakar,  Usamatu, and  Idi, and in five years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community.” With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double his yield and income

loans.name: Shaaibu

texts.en: Shaaibu remembers the starvation his family faced during a particularly bad harvest. This is before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now, as a Babban Gona member, Shaaibu like all Babban Gona members, can earn up to $2,000/hectare this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the National average of 14. However, Shaaibu,  is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. Shaaibu expressed that, “In five years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community.” With this loan, Shaaibu is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high quality inputs

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is a 32-year-old farmer from Kankanki Badamasi. As a Babban Gona member, Ibrahim is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Ibrahim can earn up to $2,000/hectare this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Ibrahim is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money to educate my children Shamsidini, Surajo, and Shamsiya. My overall goal is to become the most profitable farmer in my community”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving these goals.

loans.use: To purchase high quality inputs

loans.name: Donald Andres

texts.es: Donald es un señor esforzado  y dedicado al cuido de su familia trabaja como conductor de un bus  de transporte colectivo el cual tiene más de 10 años, además también se dedica a la crianza de cerdos actividad la cual tiene 10 años de ejercerla, soltero con 2 hijos a su cargo, actualmente este señor está solicitando el crédito Nº 13  el cual lo utilizara en la Compra de cerdas  de vientre, alimentación y vitaminas , para incrementar el inventario productivo los cuales le han dado buenos resultados durante estén tiempo como es la combinación de las dos actividades económicas.
texts.en: Donald is a courageous man who is dedicated to his family.  He works as a communal bus driver and he has had this job for over 10 years.  He also works raising pigs, which he has done for 10 years.  He is single with two children under his care.  He is currently requesting his 13th loan to buy brooding sows, feed, and vitamins to increase his productive inventory.  He has had good results during this season with the combination of his two jobs.

loans.use: to buy brooding sows, feed, and vitamins

loans.name: Denis De Los Angeles

texts.es: El señor Denis quien antes se acompañaba junto a su esposa ahora es viudo, todos sus hijos son independientes, solo se mantiene gracias a su labor como comerciante de aluminio y vidrio, solicita el crédito para comprar materiales de construcción y poder realizar un cuarto para que uno de sus hijos viva con el, así tener compañía en su hogar.
texts.en: Denis, who previously accompanied his wife, is now a widower and all of his children are grown up. He supports himself thanks to his work as a aluminium and glass dealer. He is applying for a loan to buy construction materials and to be able to make another room so one of his children can live with him and keep him company in his home.

loans.use: to buy blocks, cement, sand, and iron.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy fabrics, handbags and plastic bags

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a hardworking mother who lives with her family in Annafunan. She has a sari sari, or shop where she sells groceries to the people in her village. Since her merchandise is affordable and good quality, she has many sukis, or regular customers.

Gloria is applying for a 38,000 PHP loan through ASKI to buy soft drinks, eggs, bread, biscuits, soap and shampoo to sell. This inventory will help her increase her profits. Her aim is to have a bigger store and sell more merchandise so that she will become an evermore successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy more inventory for her shop

loans.name: Normalyn

texts.en:
Normalyn is a 49-year-old married woman with four children, three of whom are currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Normalyn has a retailing books business in the Philippines. Normalyn requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more books to sell.

Normalyn has been in this business for 8 years. In the future, Normalyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more books to sell

loans.name: Jenaline

texts.en: Jenaline is a 36-year-old, married woman with three children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Jenaline has a buy and sell rice and feed business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice and feed to sell. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Jenaline has been in this business for six years. In the future, Jenaline would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice and feed to sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is single and has a banana vending business in the Philippines.

Teresita requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more bananas for resale.

Teresita has been in this business for ten years now.

In the future, Teresita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas for resale.

loans.name: Hamisu

texts.en: Hamisu remembers feeling depressed during a particularly bad harvest. This is before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now, as a Babban Gona member, Hamisu, like all Babban Gona members, can earn up to $2,000/hectare this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the National average of 14. However, Hamisu is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  Hamisu expressed that, “In five years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community.”  With this loan, Hamisu is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high quality inputs

loans.name: Yakubu

texts.en: Yakubu is a 30-year-old farmer from Rafin Tabo. As a Babban Gona member, Yakubu is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Yakubu can earn up to $2,000/hectare this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the National average of 14. However, Yakubu is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Yakubu said, “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children Yahaya, Nagip, and Mustafa and in five years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high quality inputs

loans.name: Awo Bertha

texts.fr:
Awo Bertha, 45 ans, est mariée et mère de 4 enfants, et habite dans le quartier Tokoin à Lomé. Entre 2002 et 2010, elle est commerçante de fruits. A ce commerce elle associe en 2010 la restauration de l’igname pilée communément appelé fufu. Cette activité, étant plus rentable et nécessitant plus de temps, Awo Bertha abandonnant la vente de fruit.
Pour renforcer son activité, elle sollicite un crédit pour acheter 90 tubercules d’igname.
texts.en: Awo Bertha is 45 years old, married, and the mother of four children, and lives in the Tokoin neighborhood of Lomé. Between 2002 and 2010, she sold fruit. In 2010, she added catering of the pounded yam [dish] commonly known as fufu. [A]fter adding this business, more profitable and requiring more time, she stopped selling fruit. To expand her business, Awo Bertha is seeking a loan to purchase 90 yams.

loans.use: To purchase 90 yams.

loans.name: Roger Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Roger, trabaja como maestro de educación  secundaria, en un pequeño colegio del municipio, dedicándose a esa labor desde hace 6 años. Roger es felizmente casado y con un hijo que es el motivo por el que se esfuerza a diario en su labor educativa.
Actualmente este señor tiene la necesidad de cambiar el techo de su vivienda debido a la temporada de invierno por tal motivo se acerco a la oficina de ceprodel para solicitar un refinanciamiento el cual lo utilizara en la compra de laminas de zinc y pago de transporte. Lo que vendrá  a mejorar condiciones de vida para su familia.
texts.en: Roger works as a secondary education teacher at a small high school in town. He has worked in this profession for six years. Roger is happily married and has one son who is his motivation for working hard each day in his educational work. He currently needs to change the roof of his house in preparation for winter. For this reason, he came to the Ceprodel office to request refinancing which he will use to buy zinc laminate and shipping. This will allow him to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy 21 rolls of zinc laminate and shipping.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
Elvira vive con sus padres, su madre es costurera y el padre es empleado de una empresa. Elvira es ayudante en un transporte escolar y gracias a este trabajo puede estudiar para dedicarse a lo que le gusta y de esa forma poder mantenerse  y ayudar a su familia.
Ella está estudiando la carrera de Ciencias de la Educación, ya que quiere ser una maestra que pueda ayudar a las personas a aprender y salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus cuotas, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir trabajando y luchando por sus metas y sueños como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Elvira lives with her parents; her mother is a seamstress and her father works for a business.  Elvira is a school transportation assistant and thanks to this job she can study so she can do the work she wants to do and support herself and help her family. 

She is studying education science because she wants to be a teacher who can help people learn and get ahead. 

She is requesting this loan to pay her fees, as this will allow her to keep working and fighting for her goals and dreams, as she has been doing.

loans.use: to pay her university fees

loans.name: Marta

texts.es:
Marta esta estudiante de la carrera de Enfermería, comenta que sus Padres son quienes la están ayudando sus gastos de la universidad, y que lo hacen con mucho sacrificio.
Su sueño es poder ayudar a las personas que necesiten atención en su salud, ya que siempre quiso sentirse útil para con los demás.
Marta pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de su matrícula, lo que le será de mucha ayuda y podrá seguir estudiando como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Marta is a nursing student.  She tells us her parents are the ones helping her with her university expenses and that they sacrifice a lot to do so. 

Her dream is to be able to help people who need medical attention, as she has always wanted to be of help to others. 

Marta is requesting this loan to pay for her registration, which will be a great help and allow her to keep studying, as she has been doing.

loans.use: to pay for her university registration

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy construction materials such as iron, bricks, cement, sand, gravel, tie wire and iron bars, and to pay workers.

loans.name: Buhari

texts.en:
Buhari remembers the starvation his family faced  during a particularly bad harvest. This is before he became a Babban Gona member. Now, as a Babban Gona member, Buhari like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 

The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Buhari,  is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  Buhari expressed that, “In five years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community.” With this loan, Buhari is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double his yield and income

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr:
Âgée de 35 ans, Abla est mariée et mère de deux(02)enfants  à Cassablanca. Elle vend des  tomates, les légumes et du charbon de bois à la devanture de sa maison et s’approvisionne au marché d’Atikpodji  deux fois par mois.
Abla sollicite un microcrédit pour agrandir son commerce et de faire plus de bénéfices, puis utiliser ces bénéfices pour participer aux dépenses de sa famille.
texts.en: Abla is 35 years old, married, and the mother of two children in Cassablanca [Togo]. She sells tomatoes, vegetables, and charcoal in front of her home and gets her supplies from the Atikpodji market two times per month. Abla is seeking a microloan to expand her business and make a larger profit, then to use those profits to contribute to her family's expenses.

loans.use: To purchase one sack of onions, four containers of vegetable oil, and one basket of fresh tomatoes.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom is 45 years old and lives in a remote area of Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has two dependent children and one married child. Mom is a dessert-seller in Khnar Village. She has been running this business for 25 years and she can earn USD 5 in one day.

Mom never had her own latrine in her house, so she normally relieves herself behind her house or some available places around her house. To ensure the convenience of relieving herself, Mom is requesting a loan from Kiva to build a hygienic latrine for the sake of her family members. 

She would like to thank all lenders who always help poor people like her to gain such great financial support.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine.

loans.name: Hajara

texts.en: Hajara remembers feeling depressed during a particularly bad harvest. This was before she became a Babban Gona Member. Now, Hajara, like all Babban Gona members, can earn up to $2,000/hectare this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Hajara is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community”, expressed Hajara. With this loan, Hajara is well on her way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
La Srta. Laura es de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, está estudiando la carrera de Marketing, y comenta que a la vez que estudia también le ayuda a su madre en su negocio, y a la tarde va a la facultad.
Es una buena persona  y dedicada a sus estudios y a su familia, aspira a ser una buena profesional y seguir estudiando y servir a las personas.
Laura pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar sus cuotas de universidad, y de esa forma poder seguir luchando y siguiendo sus metas. Agradece por esta oportunidad de estudio que está recibiendo y que le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Laura is from the city of San Lorenzo.  She is studying marketing and she tells us that while she is attending school, she also helps her mother with her business and goes to class in the afternoon. 

She is a good person who is dedicated to her studies and her family.  She hopes to be a true professional and keep studying and helping people. 

Laura is requesting this loan to pay her university fees and thereby keep working and following her dreams.  She is thankful for this opportunity to study, which will be a huge help to her.

loans.use: to pay university fees

loans.name: Mirian Del Rosario

texts.es: Doña Miriam es  madre soltera,   procreo 2 hijo los cuales son mayores de edad e independiente, esta señora trabaja en un instituto de la zona donde habita desempeñándose como conserje desde hace 26 años, además ostenta otra actividad económica como es la venta de calzado la que inicio producto de la necesidad de obtener otros ingresos con fondo de ahorro de su salario, actualmente tiene la urgencia de mejorar su vivienda a través de la construcción de un cuarto por eso  visito a ceprodel para obtener un financiamiento el que utilizaría en la Compra de ladrillo, hierro, cemento ,  perlin, piedrín y pago de mano de obra, ya que la misma le creara mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Miriam is a single mother; she has two children who are adults and independent.  She has worked as a custodian for 26 years at an institution in the area where she lives; she also has a business selling shoes, which she started out of the need to make more income to save from her salary.  She currently needs to improve her home by building a room, which is why she visited Ceprodel to get a loan she will use to buy brick, rebar, cement, purlins, and gravel, and to pay for labor, as this will improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy brick, rebar, cement, purlins, and gravel, and to pay for labor

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Josephine is 41 years old and has four children who are in school.

Josephine has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11000 loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy ingredients like pork skin, cooking oil, etc. for her food production business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her food vending business.

Josephine has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like pork skin, cooking oil, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Judeven

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Judeven works hard to support her family.

She has a general store in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling bananas and rootcrops. Judeven is borrowing 11,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting this new loan to further build her business.

Judeven has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa remembers not being able to feed his family  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona member. Now,  Musa, like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 

The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Musa  is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.
