Musa has high hopes for the future; “In five years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community,” he expressed. With this loan, Musa is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double his income and yield.

loans.name: Alh. Hafisu

texts.en:
Alh. Hafisu remembers not being able to feed his family  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona member. Now,  Alh. Hafisu, like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 

The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Alh. Hafisu  is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  “In five years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community,” expressed Alh. Hafisu   With this loan, Alh. Hafisu is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double his income and yield.

loans.name: Fabiana

texts.es:
Fabiana empezó con la Carrera de Derecho, como todo un desafío, ella el día de mañana cuando termine su carrera piensa abrir un estudio jurídico y ayudar a personas que estén desamparadas.
Comenta que sus papas le ayudaron a formarme, y que el día de mañana los quiero ayudar ella por medio de la carrera que escogió.
Hoy pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar sus cuotas, ya que quiere cubrir ese gasto para poder seguir estudiando. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Fabiana started her law degree as a challenge.  In the future, when she has finished her degree, she wants to open a law office and help defenseless people. 

She tells us that her parents helped educate her and that in the future she wants help them through the career she has chosen. 

Today she is requesting this loan to pay her fees, as she wants to cover this expense so she can keep studying.  She is thankful for the opportunity she is receiving to keep growing.

loans.use: to pay university fees

loans.name: María Marina

texts.es: María tiene 36 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus cuatro hijos de 19 años, 17 años, 11 años y 5 años de edad. María es muy trabajadora y emprendedora. Desde hace mucho tiempo cuenta con un pequeño negocio de venta de minutas (postre elaborado a base de hielo raspado, jarabes de frutas, etc.) De esta forma apoya la economía de su familia. Ella solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de un cerco primetral para lo cual necesita materiales como: postes de cemento, tela ciclón, etc. Espera poder contar con dicho financiamiento y así dar inicio a la construcción lo antes posible.
texts.en: Maria is 36 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and their four children of 19, 17, 11 and 5 years of age. Maria is very hard working and enterprising. For some time she has had a small business selling "minutas" (a dessert made with shaved ice and fruit syrup). In this way she has helped with the family income. She is asking FUSAI for this loan to invest in the construction of a security fence, for which she will need materials such as cement posts, cyclone fencing and so forth. She hopes to be able to count on this financing and begin construction of the fence as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy cement posts, cyclone fencing and so forth to construct a security fence.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is single and has a dress-making business in the Philippines.

Antonia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional materials for her business, like fabric, zippers, and needles.

Antonia has been in this business for 23 years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Antonia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her business, like fabric, zippers, and needles.

loans.name: Yunana

texts.en: Yunana is a 27-year-old farmer from Rafin Tarbo.  As a Babban Gona member, Yunana is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Yunana can earn up to $2,000/hectare this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Yunana is ambitious and is aiming to reap 40 bags per hectare this season.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money to educate my children Basiru, Ibrahim, and Ummi. My overall goal is to become the most profitable farmer in my community”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving these goals.

loans.use: To purchase high quality inputs

loans.name: Usman

texts.en:
Usman is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Usman joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his  children: Nazifi, Jamilu, and  Ibraiim. Usman is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Usman will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products such as sand. 

With access to high quality inputs, Usman can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and  earn up to $2000/ha: more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make this year  as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money  to expand my farmland.” 

Usman is not thinking about this year alone; he expressed that his long-term goal is to “become the most profitable farmer in my community”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double his income and yield.

loans.name: Domingo Ramiro

texts.es:
Ramiro  se desempeña como operador de pozo  con 32 años de trabajar  en la zona donde habita, es casado, tiene una nieta a su cargo.
 Actualmente  este señor está solicitando el crédito Nº 5 el que utilizaría en tratamientos médicos, como pago de exámenes, consultas y compra de medicamentos.
Para tener mejores condiciones de salud y seguir laborando de manera normal
texts.en: Ramiro works as a well operator with 32 years experience working in the area where he lives. He is married and has a granddaughter in his care. At this time, he is asking for his fifth loan, which he will use on medical treatments, such as payment for exams, appointments with doctors and the purchase of medicines. He needs these to have a better state of health and to continue working in a normal manner.

loans.use: to pay for exams, doctor's appointments and the purchase of medicine

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es de la ciudad de Caaguazú, está en el tercer año de la carrera de Ingeniería comercial, comenta que vive con sus padres, ya que ellos siempre la apoyan en sus proyectos.
Maria quiere ser una profesional que pueda servir y ayudar a las personas de la sociedad, y también sentirse útil.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar las cuotas de su universidad, ya que de esa forma podrá asegurar el cumplimiento de sus obligaciones y podrá seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Maria is from the city of Caaguazú.  This is the third year of her commercial engineering degree.  She tells us that she lives with her parents, as they have always supported her with her plans. 

Maria wants to be a professional who can serve and help people in society and she wants to feel useful. 

She is requesting this loan to pay her university fees, as this will ensure that she meets her deadlines so she can keep studying.

loans.use: to pay university fees

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Jose es de la ciudad de Itá, vive con sus padres y comenta que está estudiando la carrera de Ingeniería Electromecánica, es una persona que se está esforzando por poder acrecentar su conocimiento para poder ayudar a su familia por medio de ellos.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir los gastos de titulación, ya que son varios los gastos que debe cubrir. Agradece por esta oportunidad que esta recibiendo, y que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Jose is from the city of Itá.  He lives with his parents and he tells us that he is studying electromechanical engineering.  He is a person who is making an effort to increase his knowledge so he can use it to help his family.  

He is requesting this loan to pay his graduation fees, as there are various fees he has to cover.  He is thankful for the opportunity he is receiving because it will be very helpful to him.

loans.use: to pay graduation fees

loans.name: Cristhian

texts.es:
Cristhian es un joven estudioso, se está dedicando mucho ya que quiere ser un profesional útil a la sociedad.
Está estudiando la carrera de Administración de Empresas, y comenta que una de sus aspiraciones son la de obtener su título y poder trabajar en su profesión. Quiere ayudar también a sus padres, ya que ellos siempre lo han ayudado.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar sus cuotas de la universidad, y de esa forma seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Cristhian is a studious young man; he is really applying himself, as he wants to be a professional who is useful to society. 

He is studying for a business administration degree and he tells us that his goals are to get his degree and to be able to work in his field.  He also wants to help his parents, as they have always helped him. 

He is requesting this loan to pay his university fees so he can continue with his studies, as he has been doing.

loans.use: to pay university fees

loans.name: Isah

texts.en:
Isah is a 45-year-old farmer from Badamasi.  As a Babban Gona member, Isah is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Isah can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 

The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the national average of 14. However, Isah is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money  to educate my children: Aminu, Naziru, and  Nasiru. My overall goal is to become the most profitable farmer in my community.” With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving these goals.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double his yield and income

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es:
Ruben es de la ciudad de Ybycuí, viene de una familia humilde, comenta que su papa es constructor, y que su mama es ama de casa.
Él ya tiene otra profesión, pero sigue estudiando, hoy estudia la carrera de derecho, ya que quiere ser un profesional que pueda ayudar a las demás personas. Quiere terminar su estudio y poder sentirse útil a la sociedad y a sí mismo.
Ruben quiere seguir estudiando, es por eso que pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar sus cuotas, ya que de esa forma estar cerca de su meta.
texts.en: Ruban is from the city of Ybycuí. He comes from a humble family and says that his father is in construction and his mother is a housewife.  He has another job but he continues to study. At present he is studying law, since he hopes to be a professional who can help other people. He wants to finish his studies and be able to feel useful to society and to himself. Ruben wants to continue studying and for this reason requests this loan to be able to invest it in the payment of his tuition and, in this way, be close to his goal.

loans.use: to pay university tuition

loans.name: Celso

texts.es:
El Sr. Celso proviene de una familia humilde, su madre falleció siendo él muy joven, se encargó de sus hermanas, luego trabajó durante 20 años como chofer de un colectivo, trabajo que  tuvo que abandonar por problemas de salud.
Fue a la Argentina buscando nuevas posibilidades de mejor vida y luego volvió al país hace unos años, dedicándose los fines de semana al macate (venta ambulante) y de lunes a vienes vende empanadas en su moto, en la ciudad de Carapeguá. Es una persona muy sacrificada y luchadora que no se ha dejado vencer.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en calzados deportivos, jeans, remeras, etc., para poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
Celso comes from a very humble family.  His mother passed away when he was very young.  He took charge of his sisters, and then he worked for 20 years as a driver for a collective.  He had to leave that work due to health problems.

He went to Argentina looking for new possibilities for a better life.  Then he returned to the country after a few years.  On the week-ends he is a street vendor.  On Mondays through Fridays he sells empanadas in the city of Carapeguá on his motorcycle.  He is a very selfless and tenacious person who has not given up.

He is requesting this loan to be able to invest in athletic shoes, jeans, and t-shirts, etc.  He will do this in order to be able to continue working like he is doing.  He is grateful for the opportunity that he is receiving.

loans.use: to buy athletic shoes, jeans, and t-shirts, etc.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Margarita, es madre de 2 hijos pequeños y se dedica al comercio desde hace 16 años, donde su negocio actual es la venta de ropa usada en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de León, ella inicia a ofertar el producto a su clientela desde las 07:00 am y finalizándolas a las 04:00 pm con el mismo horario de lunes a domingo, viaja 1 vez a la semana a Managua para la compra de su producto y realiza esta labor para la mantención de sus hijos.   

Doña Margarita, solicito a Ceprodel un crédito el que utilizo para incrementar su inventario  con productos tales como: ropa para ambos sexos, pantalones, camisas, camisetas, entre otros artículos; así lograr mayores ventas incrementando su inventario con productos de mayor calidad lo cual le permitirá obtener mayores ingresos al igual que un  mejor  nivel de vida junto a sus pequeños hijos.
texts.en:
Margarita is the mother of two small children and she has worked in commerce for 16 years.  Her current business is selling secondhand clothing in one of the markets in the city of León.  She starts selling her merchandise to her clientele at 7:00 a.m. and finishes at 4:00 p.m., with the same schedule Monday through Friday.  Once a week she travels to Managua to buy her merchandise and she does this work to support her children.  

Margarita requested a loan from Ceprodel to increase her inventory with items such as clothing for both sexes, pants, tops, and t-shirts, among others.  This will allow her to improve her sales by stocking her inventory with better-quality products, which will allow her to increase her income as well as improve her and her children's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy pants, tops, t-shirts, etc.

loans.name: Liduvina

texts.es:
La Sra. Liduvina se dedica a la venta ambulante de ropas vive en la casa de una persona que es modista, esa persona la crió como su hija.
Liduvina sale en las mañanas para la venta de sus prendas, tiene clientes seguros y por las tardes trabaja en un estudio jurídico como asistente. Tiene pensado construir su casa propia, ya cuenta con un terreno y está ahorrando para independizarse y tener su propio local en futuro. Es soltera y no tiene hijo. Solicita el préstamo para compra de jeans y pantalones para el invierno, y de esa forma tener una mayor variedad de prendas que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Liduvina works selling clothing on foot.  She lives in the home of a fashion designer; this person raised her like a daughter. 

Liduvina goes out in the morning to sell her garments; she has steady customers and in the afternoons she works as an assistant at a law firm.  She is thinking about building her won home because she has some land and she is saving to become independent and have her own shop in the future.  She is single and does not have children.  She is requesting a loan to buy jeans and pants for winter and thereby have a wider variety of garments to offer to her customers.

loans.use: to buy jeans and pants for winter

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea is 42 years old, married, and has five children, one currently in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Lea has a business direct selling Avon products in the Philippines. Lea requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more Avon products to sell to her customers.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Lea has been in this business for five years. Lea would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more Avon products to sell to her customers

loans.name: Abdulrahaman

texts.en:
Abdulrahaman is a 50-year-old farmer from Badamasi. As a Babban Gona member, Abdulrahaman, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Abdulrahaman can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 

The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the National average of 14. However, Abdulrahaman is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Abdulrahaman said “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children: Aliyu, and  Saminu, and in five years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community.” With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double his yield and income

loans.name: Jummai

texts.en:
Jummai is a 35-year-old farmer from Kwankwani. As a Babban Gona member, Jummai, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Jummai can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 

The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the national average of 14. However, Jummai is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Jummai said,  “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children: Ruya,   Raimon, and  Emmanuel, and in five years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community.” With this loan, she is well on her way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double her yield and income

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en:
Habiba is a 20-year-old farmer from Kwankwani.  As a Babban Gona member, Habiba  is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Habiba can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 

The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the national average of 14. However, Habiba is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  When asked how she plans to spend the income she will make as a Babban Gona member, she said, “I plan to use the money  to educate my children. My overall goal is to become the most profitable farmer in my community.” With this loan, she is well on her way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double her yield and income

loans.name: Phat

texts.en: Phat is a 60-year-old widow with one child and lives in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a farmer and her son is on the staff at a hotel. Both of them can earn approximately $11 per day. Now, she would like to apply for loan of (USD) $1,000 to purchase beautiful fishes to resell for profit. This loan will help her make more income for her family. In the future, she hopes that her son can get a bachelor's degree.

loans.use: To purchase beautiful fishes to resell for profit

loans.name: En Group

texts.en: En is 56 years old, married, and resides with her husband and two children in Tbong Khmum Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been involved in farming since 1983. En is the leader of this borrower group. She will use her portion of the group’s loan to buy the ground parts of a latrine. This loan will help her family live in better conditions. In the future, En hopes that she can build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: To buy the ground parts of a latrine

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Jose es padre de familia, está estudiando y trabajando a la vez, para poder cubrir sus gastos y el de su familia. Él quiere superarse cada dia y darles un buen futuro a sus hijos.
Su aspiracion es tener su titulo y ser un buen docente. Está estudiando la carrera de formación docente para poder acrecentar su conocimiento y poder ser un buen maestro y ayudar a las personas que al igual que el quieran aprender.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar sus clases de universidad, y de esa forma poder seguir estudiando y luchando.
texts.en:
Jose is the father of a family. He is both attending school and working at the same time in order to cover his and his family’s expenses. 

Every day he wants to better himself and give his children a good future. His dream is to earn his degree and to become a good teacher. He is studying for a teaching career in order to increase his knowledge, become a good teacher and help people who, like him, want to learn.

He is requesting this loan to pay for his university classes so he can continue studying and struggling.

loans.use: to pay university expenses.

loans.name: Bopha

texts.en: Bopha is a 53-year-old widow with three children and lives in Odong, Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been running a business of buying and selling recycled waste and earns approximately $3 per day. All of her children are employed and earn around $16 per day. Now, she would like to apply for loan of (USD) $1,000 to purchase farmland to grow rice crops. This loan will help her make more income. In the future, she hopes that she can renovate her house.

loans.use: To purchase farmland to grow rice crops

loans.name: Bernarda

texts.es:
Bernarda es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora, en su despensa todos los días trabaja desde muy tempranas horas del día, hasta muy entrada la noche. Comenta que gracias a su préstamo anterior pudo surtir su negocio con productos varios.
Hoy pide un nuevo préstamo para poder invertirlo nuevamente en la compra de productos para poder surtir su negocio, con verduras, enlatados, bebidas, frutas y otros insumos. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe nuevamente de poder crecer.
texts.en: Bernarda is a hardworking, xxx person.  In her store, every day she works from early morning until well in the evening. She says that, thanks to her previous loan, she was able to supply her business with a variety of products. Now she is asking for a new loan to be able to invest again in the purchase of products to stock her business with vegetables, canned goods, drinks, fruits and other items. She appreciates the opportunity to receive again the possiblity to grow.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, canned goods, drinks, fruits and other items

loans.name: Santa Lucia Group

texts.es:
Santa Lucia es un grupo muy unido que está luchando y tiene las esperanzas puestas en que a través del trabajo unido y el esfuerzo podrán ir creciendo y mejorando.
Tita es integrante de este grupo, ella es una mujer muy humilde, que se dedica a la venta de remedios naturales que lo hace en forma ambulante. Gracias a este humilde trabajo que está haciendo, se abre camino para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos, para que no pasen por necesidades.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de remedios naturales para poder seguir trabajando, y ganándose la vida de una forma digna y honesta.
texts.en:
Santa Lucia is a very united group that is working hard and hoping to grow and improve little by little through their collective work and effort.

Tita belongs to this group. She is a very humble woman who works selling natural remedies as a street vendor. The humble work she is doing allows her to make her way in order to help her loved ones and provide for them.

She is requesting this loan in order to invest in purchasing natural remedies so that she can keep working and earning a decent and honest living.

loans.use: Coto buy natural remedies to sell.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es:
El Sr.  Leonardo tiene 37 años, es soltero, y aun no tiene hijos, comenta que se inició en la venta de carnes hace más de 3 años,   aproximadamente desde el año 2.011.
El comenzó con el capital que trajo desde el exterior y que gracias al duro trabajo que realizó para conseguirlo, él comenzó con una pequeña carnicería, que al pasar el tiempo fueron conociéndolo y sumaba clientes.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar carnes al por mayor, de manera a poder surtir más su negocio y tener una mayor variedad que ofrecer.
texts.en:
Señor Leonardo is 37 years old. He is single and doesn't have any children yet. He says that he got started in the meat sales business more than three years ago.

Leonardo started with capital that he brought from out of the country; thanks to the hard work that he did to earn it, he started a small meat market. As time passed, his market became better known and his customer base increased.

He is requesting this loan so that he can buy meat at wholesale. That way, he will be able to better stock his business and offer greater variety.

loans.use: to buy meat to sell

loans.name: Mujeres Virtuosas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Virtuosas está en su ciclo número 4 del programa de comité de mujeres, es un numeroso grupo que se unió con la expectativa de ir superando las barreras de la pobreza, ayudado también con la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Antonia quien entre el trabajo que ella hace se dedica a la venta de comida, que ella misma hace y después sale a vender de manera ambulante. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y por sobre todo emprendedora que con sacrificio, esfuerzo y lucha está mejorando sus condiciones de vida para ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de materia prima para hacer sus comidas, como ser verduras, carne, condimentos, pollo, jamón, queso y demás. Todas están agradecidas por esta oportunidad que están recibiendo, y que les ayudará a crecer.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Virtuosas Group is in its fourth cycle in the women's communal bank program; it is a big group that got together with the goal of overcoming the obstacles of poverty with the help of a survey on the elimination of poverty.  

One of the members is Antonia who, among other things, sells prepared food that she makes herself and then goes out to sell on foot.  She is a very hardworking and above all enterprising person who through sacrifice, work, and determination is improving her living conditions to help her family.  

She is requesting this loan to pay for raw material to make her prepared foods, such as vegetables, meat, condiments, chicken, ham, cheese, etc.  They are all thankful for the opportunity they are receiving, which is helping them grow.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, condiments, chicken, ham, cheese, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Liza

texts.en:
Ma. Liza is a 40-year-old married woman with five children, three currently in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Ma. Liza has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Ma. Liza requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell to her customers.

Ma. Liza has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Ma. Liza would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell to her customers

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is 36 years old and married with three children.

Salvacion works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

Salvacion has borrowed and paid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables.

Salvacion aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Danilo Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Danilo tiene amplia experiencia en la realización de actividades agropecuarias y manejo del campo.
El se dedica a la producción de tomate a pequeña escala realizando mantenimiento diario a sus cultivos para poder cosechas de buena calidad.
El solicita un préstamo para la compra de semillas de tomate e insumos para el tratamiento de sus tierras.
Su mayor sueño y objetivo es poder empezar a producir su producto a una escala mayor, dándose la oportunidad de aumentar sus ingresos y tener unas utilidades más estables.
Sabe que esto solo se consigue con la ayuda de entidades que apoyen el crecimiento de los emprendedores y personas con deseos de progreso.
texts.en:
Señor Danilo has extensive experience carrying out farming and land management activities. He earns his living producing tomatoes on a small scale by maintaining his crops on a daily basis in order to have high-quality harvests. He is requesting a loan to purchase tomato seeds and supplies for treating his soil.

His greatest dream is to be able to start producing his product on a larger scale, giving himself the opportunity to increase his income and have more stable profits. He knows that he can only achieve this with the help of entities that support the growth of entrepreneurs and people who have the desire to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy tomato seeds and agricultural supplies

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Sara is a 30-year-old farmer from Kwankwani.  As a Babban Gona member, Sara is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Sara can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 

The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the national average of 14. However, Sara is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  When asked how she plans to spend the income she will make as a Babban Gona member, she said, “I plan to use the money  to educate my children: Ummi, Peice, and  Clement. My overall goal is to become the most profitable farmer in my community.” With this loan, she is well on her way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double her yield and income

loans.name: Malai

texts.en: Malai is 46 years old, married, has four children, and lives in Odong, Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been selling vegetables since 2005 and her husband has been providing transportation services to clients since 2010. Both of them can earn approximately (USD) $14 per day. Now, she would like to apply for a loan of (USD) $1,500 to build a motorcycle repair shop for providing services to clients. This loan will help her husband make more income for the family. In the future, she hopes that she can renovate her house and her children can get their high school diplomas.

loans.use: To build a motorcycle repair shop to provide services to clients

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Touch is 47 years old, married, has eight children, and lives in Odong, Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been farming since 1983 and her husband has been working as a laborer, grinding rice, since 2010. Both of them can earn approximately (USD) $8.50 per day. Three of her children are employed and earn approximately (USD) $12 per day. Now, she would like to apply for a loan of (USD) $1,500 to purchase cows for plowing her farmland. In the future, she hopes that she can buy more farmland.

loans.use: To purchase cows for farming.

loans.name: Yorn

texts.en: Yorn is 45 years old, married, has three children, and lives in Odong, Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She is a factory laborer and her husband is a farmer. Both of them can earn approximately (USD) $6 per day. Two of her children are employed and earn approximately (USD) $10 per day. Now, she would like to apply for a loan of (USD) $1,000 to purchase more farmland to grow rice crops. This loan will help her make more income for the family. In the future, she hopes that she can build a bathroom and a toilet.

loans.use: To purchase more farmland to cultivate

loans.name: Cristian

texts.es:
Cristian está en el cuarto año de la carrera de Análisis de sistemas, está trabajando y estudiando a la vez, de esa forma está luchando por poder ser un buen profesional que sea útil a las demás personas.
Se define como una persona que se esfuerza por poder cumplir sus metas y anhelos, y pide este préstamo para poder comprarse una computadora y de esa forma cumplir con los trabajos que tiene en la universidad.
Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo, y que le permitirá seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Cristian is in his fourth year studying systems analysis. He is both working and attending school at the same time. Thus he is struggling to become a good professional who will be useful to others.

He defines himself as a person who does his utmost to fulfill his wishes and goals. He is requesting this loan to purchase a computer so he can perform his university work. 

He is grateful for this opportunity that will enable him to continue studying.

loans.use: to purchase a computer.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en: Marietta is 41 years old, married to a farmer, and blessed with three children. She's been hog raising for almost four years, earning a net income of PHP 2,000 per hog. Due to insufficient funds, she would like a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase hogs to raise and hog feed. Her income from this business is usually spent on the school allowances of their children. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can able to improve her business to earn more income for her family.

loans.use: To purchase hogs to raise and hog feed.

loans.name: Las Preferidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Las Preferidas  está en el ciclo 1, es un grupo nuevo que a la vez está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, a través de la cual podrán conocer la situación de cada una de ellas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Hilda, ella  se dedica a la venta de ropas, cosméticos y también es empleada doméstica, en su última encuesta mostró que ha ido mejorando bastante, y que quiere seguir haciéndolo. También se debe destacar el trabajo de las asesoras, quienes hacen un seguimiento permanente de capacitaciones y verificaciones.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas varias, para que de esa forma tenga una mayor variedad de productos que poder ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group Las Preferidas is in its first cycle. It is a new group, and they are also completing the poverty elimination survey, which will allow them to know the situation of each member. The work of the consultants should also be noted, since they are constantly following up on trainings and certifications.

Hilda is one of the members of this group. She works selling clothing and cosmetics and also as a domestic. Her last survey showed that she has substantially improved and that she wants to keep improving. She is requesting this loan in order to buy assorted clothing items, so that she can have a wider variety of merchandise to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy assorted clothing items to sell.

loans.name: Yeneris Maria

texts.es:
Yeneris ha podido apreciar como su trabajo constante ha permitido que su negocio crezca gradualmente y tenga una muy buena acogida entre los habitantes del municipio de Sahagún, Córdoba.
Ella se desempeña como estilista desde hace mas de 10 años donde decidió capacitarse para ser profesional y tener un trabajo independiente.
Hasta ahora manifiesta que le ha ido muy bien y que gracias a este negocio ha podido sacar a su familia adelante.
Ella necesita un préstamo para la compra de muebles como sillas de corte, y camillas para realizar manicure, estos le permitirán prestar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, adicionalmente requiere de dos vitrinas para exhibir sus productos como tratamientos para el cabello y esmaltes, estos elementos resultaran mucho más atractivos para sus clientes.
Su sueño es poder seguir creciendo como empresaria y como persona.
texts.en:
Yeneris has been able to appreciate how her constant work has allowed her business go gradually grow.  She also appreciates how it is very well-received among the inhabitants of the Sahagún municipality in Córdoba.

She has been working as a stylist for over ten years.  She decided to train to be a professional and to have an independent job.  She states that so far it has gone very well.  Thanks to this business, she has been able to get her family ahead.

She needs a loan to buy furniture like chairs for cutting hair, and furniture to do manicures.  These will allow her to provide better service to her customers.  Additionally, she needs two display cases to exhibit her products like hair treatments and nail polish.  These items will make it much more attractive to her customers.

Her dream is to be able to continue growing as a businesswoman and as a person.

loans.use: to buy furniture for cutting hair and giving manicures, and two display cases.

loans.name: Amparo Leticia

texts.es: Amparo tiene 42 años de edad, ella vive con su esposo y con su esposo que se dedica al jornal de trabajo en el campo, y también vive con su hijo de 12 años que se encuentra asistiendo a la escuela, Amparo va a invertir el crédito en la compra de chanchos, ya que ha este negocio se dedica 15 años, Amparo espera progresar con su negocio y así mejorar la calidad de vida sobre todo de su hijo.
texts.en: Amparo is 42 years of age and lives with her husband who earns his living as a farm laborer. She also lives with their 12 year old son who attends school. Amparo will invest her loan in the purchase of pigs, a business she has spent 15 years in. Amparo hopes to progress with her business and in this way improve their quality of life, especially for their son.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Hussaini

texts.en:
Hussaini is a 28-year-old farmer from Gwanki. As a Babban Gona member, Hussaini, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Hussaini can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 

The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Hussaini is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Hussaini said, “I plan to use the money I make to build a better home; in five years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community.” With this loan, Hussaini is on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double his income and yield

loans.name: Yahaya

texts.en:
Yahaya is a 40-year-old farmer from Gwanki.  As a Babban Gona member, Yahaya, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist.  Like all Babban Gona members, Yahaya can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 

The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the national average of 14. However, Yahaya is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Yahaya said, “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children: Mashakuru, Ibrahim, and Yau, and in five years, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double his income and yield

loans.name: Edilma Del Socorro

texts.es:
Desde hace 12 años la señora Edilma, de 35 años viene desempeñándose como confeccionista de ropa en contratación con terceros, es una actividad aprendida a través de un curso realizado en la empresa donde laboro por más de 4 años. Tomo la iniciativa motivada por el afán de conseguir ingresos para el sostenimiento de su hijo de 7 años y adicionalmente para conseguir esa independencia que tanto había soñado.
Ella trabaja todos los días de 7:00 am a 6:00 Pm y actualmente ofrece empleo a dos personas.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de una maquina plana que le permita aumentar su capacidad de producción y mejorar su prestación de servicio.
Su mayor sueño es poder tener un gran taller consolidado y con gran capacidad de trabajo.
texts.en:
For twelve years, Edilma, who is 35 years old, has been working as a third-party seamstress.  It is a career she learned though a course she took at a business where she worked for four years.  She took the initiative motivated by a desire to earn enough to support her seven-year-old son as well as to achieve the independence she had dreamed of for so long. 

She works ever day from 7:00 am to 6:00 pm and she currently employs two people. 

She is currently requesting a loan to buy a lockstitch machine that will allow her to increase her production capacity and improve the service she offers. 

Her greatest dream is to have a big, established workshop with a huge work capacity.

loans.use: to buy a lockstitch machine

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Pablo proviene de una familia humilde y luchadora, comenta que su objetivo es poder tener su título y por medio de ello poder ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos.
Pablo está estudiando la carrera de hotelería y turismo, ya que de esa forma quiere aplicarlo a lo lindo de nuestro país, y de las áreas hermosas que tiene.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar sus gastos de transporte, lo que le permitirá cubrir ese gran gasto que mes a mes tiene. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo y que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Pablo comes from a modest, hardworking family. He notes that his objective is to get his degree and in this way help his family and loved ones.

Pablo is studying for a career in hospitality and tourism because he wants to apply what he learns to our lovely country and the beautiful regions it has.

He is requesting this loan to pay for transportation costs so he can cover this large expense he has month after month. He is grateful for this opportunity, which will help him very much.

loans.use: to pay for transportation expenses.

loans.name: Tania Del Rosario

texts.es:
Tania es una joven emprendedora, tiene 18 años de edad, es soltera y vive en Guadalupe junto a su familia.
Actualmente estudia la carrera de Biología y desde hace 2 años brinda clases particulares a niños de edad escolar y le va muy bien porque es una persona que muy trabajadora, con muchos deseos de superación y sobre todo porque quiere contribuir a que sus alumnos puedan convertirse en excelentes profesionales.
Tania está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprarse un juego de dormitorio para que pueda descansar mejor y así seguir dictando sus clases como lo ha hecho hasta ahora y seguirá esforzándose para cumplir su gran sueño: “Ser una excelente profesional”
texts.en:
Tania is an enterprising young woman; she is 18 years old, single, and lives in Guadalupe with her family. 

She is currently pursuing a degree in biology and she has been teaching private classes for children for two years.  It is going very well for her because she is a very hardworking person with a great desire to better herself and above all because she wants to contribute to her students becoming excellent professionals. 

Tania is thankful to Kiva's lenders because, with the support they have offered her, she will be able to buy herself bedroom furniture so she can rest better and keep giving her classes as she has up until now and keep applying herself to achieve her greatest dream: "To be an excellent professional."

loans.use: to buy bedroom furniture

loans.name: Santa Librada Group

texts.es:
El grupo Santa Librada está en el  ciclo número 1 del programa de Comité, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Paulina, quien se dedica a la venta de ropas varias para damas, gracias a esta actividad ella se encuentra mejorando cada vez más su situación económica, pero igualmente está consciente de que este trabajo y esfuerzo que está haciendo debe ser continuo y permanente para lograr un éxito total, ya que con ello podrá dar un mejor bienestar a su familia. 
La Sra. Paulina  solicita  este préstamo para la compra de mercaderías tales como prendas de vestir para invierno, de tal manera a aumentar su stock de trabajo, el cual le ayudará a mejorar cada vez más sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group Santa Librada is in its first cycle with the committee program, where all the members work and help each other get ahead. 

Paulina is one of the members of this group. She works selling assorted women's clothing. This business is allowing her to increasingly improve her financial situation, but at the same time she is aware that the work and effort she is putting into her business needs to be consistent and constant in order to achieve total success and to give her family more wellbeing.

Paulina is requesting this loan to buy merchandise like winter clothing items. This will increase her working stock, which will help her increasingly improve her income.

loans.use: to buy clothing items.

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en:
Yusuf is a 33-year-old farmer from Gwanki.  As a Babban Gona member, Yusuf, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist.  Like all Babban Gona members, Yusuf can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 

The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Yusuf is ambitious and is aiming to reap 50 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Yusuf said, “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children: Aimana, Paty, and Ahmed, and in five years, I want to make more money for myself and my family.” With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double his income and yield

loans.name: Gemalyn

texts.en:
Gemalyn, 37 years of age, is married to a driver and blessed with two children. She has managed a hog-raising business in their village for almost ten years and earns a net income of PHP 6,000 for five hogs. 

Due to lack of capital, Gemalyn would like to avail herself of a loan, amounting to PHP 10,000, to purchase a supply of hog feed. Her net income is usually spent on the school allowances of their children. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted, so that she can further improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a supply of hog feed.

loans.name: Santa Rosa Group

texts.es:
Santa Rosa está en el ciclo 12, están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde este año 2 integrantes  se encontraban por debajo  de la línea de pobreza, y quienes se están esforzando de una manera extra para poder ir mejorando sus vidas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Elisa, ella  tiene una despensa y carnicería bien surtida en la zona  hace varios años y con una clientela bien formada, en su última encuesta se encontraba mejorando su situación de pobreza, pero de igual manera sigue muy entusiasmada invirtiendo su tiempo y esfuerzo para poder seguir creciendo, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir ayudando a su familia todo para una vida digna. 
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos varios para su despensa, como ser bebidas, verduras, frutas, carne y demás insumos para poder seguir creciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que están recibiendo todas de seguir creciendo y luchando por mejorar su situación.
texts.en:
Santa Rosa is in its twelfth cycle. They are completing the poverty elimination survey, which showed that this year two of its members are below the poverty line, so they are working extra hard in order to gradually improve their lives.

Elisa is one of the members of this group. She has been running a local grocery store and meat market for several years. It is well-stocked and has a solid customer base. Her last survey showed she is still improving her poverty situation, but she is still very enthusiastic about investing her time and effort in order to be able to keep growing, because it will allow her to continue helping her family have a decent life.

She is requesting this loan to invest in buying assorted items for her store, such as drinks, vegetables, fruit, meat, and other products, so that she can keep growing. She is grateful for the opportunity they are all getting to grow and to keep fighting for a better situation.

loans.use: to buy drinks, vegetables, fruit, meat, and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion is 46 years old and single. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock like detergent soap, shampoo, toothpaste, hair conditioner, etc. to sell.

Consolacion has borrowed and paid back seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from weaving.

Consolacion aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like detergent soap, shampoo, toothpaste, hair conditioner, etc. to sell

loans.name: Olga

texts.fr:
Âgée de 42 ans, Olga est divorcée et mère de deux(02) enfants à Cassablanca. Elle est coiffeuse de formation et associe la vente des mèches, tissages, et pagnes à son activité. Elle achète des pagnes traditionnels au marché de Ouagadougou au Burkina Faso qu’elle revend à Lomé une fois par mois.
Olga sollicite un prêt pour agrandir son commerce afin de faire plus de bénéfices et  s’occuper de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Olga, 42 years old, is divorced and the mother of two children in Cassablanca. She is a trained beautician and sells artificial hair, weaves and lengths of cloth as well as plying her trade. She buys lengths of traditional  African print cloth at the market in Ouagadougou in Burkino Faso and resells it in Lomé once a month. 

Olga is requesting a loan to grow her business in order to make more profit and better care for her children.

loans.use: to buy 50 yards of bazin (locally dyed cloth) and 30 lengths of traditional African print cloth

loans.name: Reine

texts.fr:
Reine âgée de 39 ans, célibataire avec deux enfants en charge dans le quartier de Tokoin, elle vend  depuis 2009 les ignames frites. Elle vend aussi des fruits et s’approvisionne deux fois par mois à Kpalimé ville située à 120km de Lomé.
Reine sollicite un microcrédit pour agrandir son commerce afin de faire plus de bénéfices et s’ occuper de ses enfants
texts.en:
Reine, aged 39, is single and raising two children. In the Tokoin district, she has been selling fried yams since 2009. She also sells fruit and stocks up twice a month in  Kpalimé, a town that is located 120 km from Lomé.

Reine is requesting a micro loan to grow her business so that she will make more profit and can take care of her children.

loans.use: to buy two baskets of oranges and two baskets of avocados

loans.name: Idris Kusa

texts.en: Idris Kusa remembers his family struggling to survive during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona member. Now, Idris Kusa, like all Babban Gona members, can earn up to $2,000/hectare this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Idris Kusa is ambitious and is aiming to reap 50 bags per hectare this season.  “In five years, I want to ensure other members of my community are lifted out of poverty”, expressed Idris Kusa. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Fermin

texts.es:
El Sr. Fermin es soltero aún vive con sus padres, tiene una panadería en la que trabaja con sus padres, comenta que anteriormente trabajaba en una panadera donde aprendió el oficio, y con una plata que junto compro las primeras máquinas para hacer los panificados.
Gracias al trabajo que realiza esta familia están comprando más maquinarias para que de esa manera vayan aumentando su producción y puedan dar mejor calidad a sus clientes.
Fermin pide este préstamo para poder comprar materia prima para sus panificados, como ser harina, sal, levadura, mantecas y demás, y de esa forma seguir produciendo panificados de calidad.
texts.en:
Fermin is single and still lives with his parents. He has a bakery where he works alongside his parents. He says he used to work at another bakery where he learned the trade, and saved up some money to buy the first of his baking equipment.

The work that this family is doing is allowing them to purchase more equipment in order to increase production and give their customers better quality.

Fermin is requesting this loan to buy ingredients for his baked goods, such as flour, salt, yeast, butter, and other products. This will allow him to keep making quality baked goods.

loans.use: to buy flour, salt, yeast, butter, and other ingredients for baking.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock for her business

loans.name: Halima

texts.ru:
Халима жительница города Худжанд. Она живет там с мужем, свёкорю и двумя детьми. Ее муж торговец, а свёкор пенсионер. Халима давно занимается шитьем. Вот уже 10 лет она предоставляет услуги швеи у себя дома. Она имеет своих постоянных клиенток, которые всегда пользуются ее услугами. Халима ответственный и трудолюбивый человек. Она за каждый свой заказ берется с ответственностью. Фасоны для платьев она придумывает сама. Сейчас для продолжения шитья ей необходимо закупить ткани. Но так как собственных средств не хватает, она обратилась за кредитом. 
Халима в будущем планирует расширить свою деятельность и открыть собственный швейный цех.
texts.en: Halima is a resident of the city of Khujand. She lives there with her husband, mother-in-law and two children. Her husband is a seller, and mother-in-law is retired. Halima has been involved in sewing for a long time. She has been providing sewing services at home for 10 years. She has her own regular clients, who always use her services. Halima is a responsible and hardworking person. She treats each order with great responsibility. She creates dress fashions by herself. She has to now purchase fabrics to continue sewing. But because she does not have her own money, she requested this loan. In the future, Halima plans to expand her business and open a sewing factory.

loans.use: to purchase necessary fabrics for sewing

loans.name: Dúo Luna Group

texts.es:
DUO LUNA 
Este duo esta conformado por el señor Mynor quin es propietarios de una herreria ubicada en balcones san cristobal padre de familia de 2 hijos y tiene 5 años de tener su negocio, el señor maynor trabaja todo lo que se refiere a mostradore, puerta, ventanas rejas etc... este es un oficio que aprendio desde muy joven pues debido a la crisis economica que sufria su familia no estudio si no que se dedico a  trabajar para aportar con el sustento de su familia, el no quiere que sus hijos sufran lo mismo si no que el anhela que ellos estudien y que sean profesionales y es por ello que dia a dia se esfuerza para poder darles lo mejor a ellos. El ha escuchado hablar de FAPE Y KIVA y se ha interesado en adquirir un credito para la compra de algunas herramientas que aun le faltan en su negocio y es por ello que acude a FAPE para poder adquirirlo y con ello pues producir aun mas en su negocio y dar un buen estilo de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
The Duo Luna group has two members, one of whom is Mynor, who is the owner of a blacksmith's shop in Balcones San Cristobal. He is the father of 2 sons and has had his business for 5 years. 

Blacksmithing is an occupation which he learned at a very young age. Because of the economic crisis his family found themselves in, he did not study but worked to contribute to the support of his family.

Mynor does not want his children to suffer the same way, but wishes that they study and become professionals. It is for this reason that day by day he fights to be able to give them the best. 

He heard of FAPE and KIVA and is interested in taking out a loan in order to buy some tools which he does not have yet in his business and to acquire these is the reason he has turned to FAPE. With these tools he can produce even more in his business and give his family a good standard of living.

loans.use: to buy blacksmith's materials.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is 30 years old and is single. He has been operating a hotel business for the past five years. Alex earns a monthly income of 7,000 KES.
 
This is his second loan with Vision Fund Kenya. Alex plans to use the loan to buy cooking ingredients like sugar, flour, cooking oil, etc. He plans to use the profits to purchase building materials and in future to own a plot of land.

loans.use: to purchase cooking ingredients like sugar, flour, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Disan

texts.en:
Disan is 32 years old and lives in the town of Luwero in the Luwero region of Uganda. He is Married and has one child. For the past 6 years, Disan has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells essential commodities. 

To help expand his business, Disan has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential goods like sugar and salt for his business, and will help Disan to generate greater profits and improve his family's standard of living. Disan hopes that in the future he will be able to expand the business into a wholesale shop. 

Disan is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Disan who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential goods like sugar and salt for his business

loans.name: Lami Simon

texts.en: Lami Simon remembers not being able to feed her family during a particularly bad harvest. This was before she became a Babban Gona member. Now, Lami Simon, like all Babban Gona members, can earn up to $2,000/hectare this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Lami Simon is ambitious and is aiming to reap 80 bags per hectare this season. “In five years, I want to make more money for myself and my family”, expressed Lami Simon.  With this loan, she is well on her way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Holloness

texts.en:
Holloness is a married woman and owns a house that has piped water, but not electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food and fees for her 3 school going kids.
 
Holloness has operated a tailoring business for the past 4 years. She makes women's suits and men's suits. In addition, she has a shop in which she sells food consumables to her fellow villagers. 

With the 10,000 KES, she wants to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, and beans for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, and beans

loans.name: Safinah Talatu

texts.en: Safinah Talatu remembers not being able to feed or clothe her family during a particularly bad harvest. This was before she became a Babban Gona member. Now, Safinah Talatu, like all Babban Gona members, can earn up to $2,000/hectare this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Safinah Talatu is ambitious and is aiming to reap 70 bags per hectare this season.  “In five years, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”, expressed Safinah Talatu.  With this loan, she is well on her way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Bala

texts.en:
Bala is a 30-year-old farmer from Gwanki.  As a Babban Gona member, Bala is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist.  Like all Babban Gona members, Bala can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 

The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Bala is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Bala said, “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children: Paty, Kadiji, and Sa'idu, and in five years, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double his income and yield

loans.name: Denis

texts.en:
Denis is 28 years old and lives in the town of Wobulezi in the Luwero region of Uganda. He is married and has two children with one of them currently in school. For the past three years, Denis has been working hard to manage his retail shop which sells textile clothes. 

To help expand his business, Denis has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more textiles for clothes for sale, and will help Denis to generate greater profits and improve his family's standard of living . Denis hopes that in the future he will be able to own an electric tailoring machine. 

Denis is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Denis who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more textiles for clothes for sale

loans.name: Lesbia Maribel

texts.es: Lesbia solicita este crédito con el fin de Invertir en su negocio de Celulares, ya que actualmente sus ganancias solo le dan para comprar la misma cantidad que vende, no así para incrementar, pues ella tiene dos niños menores de edad que mantener y con la ganancia ajusta para sus gastos básicos.  Si bien es cierto que cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo en el negocio ya que también es comerciante, pues siendo una familia bien unida y comparten los gastos, pero ambos dependen del mismo negocio y han pensado surtirlo y realizar ventas a domicilio para mejorar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Lesbia requests this loan in order to invest in her mobile phone business since at the moment her earnings are only enough to buy the same amount that she sells and not enough to expand. She has two underage children to support and she makes do with her earnings to pay for basic expenses. She gets help for her business from her husband since he is also a salesperson and they are a united family that shares the expenses. However, both of them depend on the same business and have thought of supplying it and sell door-to-door to improve their earnings and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones for her business

loans.name: Miguel

texts.en:
Miguel owns and operates a transportation service and has earned good income for more than five years. He had successfully repaid his previous loan used for buying spare parts.He has other employment and despite a busy schedule, makes time for transportation services which helps him meet his daily expenses. Recently, he took a new loan to purchase new tires for his transportation service.
Miguel plans to improve the general living conditions of his family and his business as well.

loans.use: to purchase new tires

loans.name: Gil

texts.en:
Gil lives in the village of Gata Daku Clarin, Misamis Occidental with his family.
He owns and operates a business venture providing motor transportation services. He also works as a security guard for a private company.  

Gil has successfully repaid his previous loans that he used for this business. Recently, Gil requested a new loan to cover the costs of motor transportation maintenance. He plans to use the generated profit from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to cover the costs of motor transportation maintenance.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is a 47-year-old married man. He has two children with ages ranging from 2 to 10 years old. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a shoe repair business. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a developing area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of finances. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase additional shoe repair materials. His business goal is to be able to sell shoes to customers within five years. He hopes that in the future, his business will sustain his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional shoe repair materials

loans.name: Micheal

texts.en:
Micheal is a 24-year-old married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be ambitious. 

He operates a transport service. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a developing area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of financial resources. 

He will use the 20,000 Kenya Shillings (KES) loan to buy motorcycle spare parts

He hopes that in the future, he will have a stable business that will sustain his family. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more bicycles

loans.name: Grecelda

texts.en:
Grecelda is single and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Grecelda requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Grecelda has been in this business for 14 years now.

In the future, Grecelda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rosa Marissa

texts.en:
Rosa Marissa is 43 years old and married. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Rosa Marissa has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Rosa Marissa requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Rosa Marissa has been in this business for three years. In the future, Rosa Marissa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She is requesting a loan to purchase more stock  wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and tea leaves for her business. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more stock  wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and tea leaves for her business.

loans.name: Simba

texts.en:
Simba is a widowed woman who has seven kids. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to local neighbours. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuation in her business. She dreams of expanding to a café business. 

With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, rice, maize flour, rice and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, rice, maize flour, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Manyama Development Group

texts.en:
Mathias is a married man aged 40 years with 2 children, one of whom is attending school. He deals in farming and is also a produce trader. He started this  business to improve on his standard of living and that of his family. He is acquiring the loan to boost his agricultural business through buying more agricultural products that he will sell at a profit to increase his income. His clients are traders from the cities and residents. He hopes to build rentals and to improve on his passion fruits business which is his other source of income.

His challenges are the pests and diseases that attack the crops. He describes himself as a trustworthy and hardworking man who appreciates the services lender's offer.

loans.use: to buy beans and maize for sell

loans.name: Nasiru

texts.en: Nasiru is a 40-year-old farmer from Gwanki. As a Babban Gona member, Nasiru is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Nasiru can earn up to $2,000/hectare this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Nasiru is ambitious and is aiming to reap 120 bags per hectare this season. When asked about his ambitions as a Babban Gona member, Nasiru said, “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children Masa'Udu and Amina. In five years, I want to ensure other members of my community are lifted out of poverty”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high quality inputs

loans.name: Danyaro

texts.en: Danyaro remembers the starvation his family faced during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona member. Now, as a Babban Gona member, Danyaro like all Babban Gona members, can earn up to $2000/hectare this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Danyaro, is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 35 bags per hectare this season.  When asked about his future ambitions, Danyaro said; “In five years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community.”  With this loan, Danyaro is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high quality inputs

loans.name: Blanca Yovana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal KIMOYGANAKERA MAGANIROIGI,el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Echarate,provincia La Convención y departamento Cusco.
La socia Blanca tiene 42 años tiene 02 hijos y es conviviente, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende diferentes tipos d productos como arroz, azúcar, leche  entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia, este préstamo es parte de una de las líneas de crédito de la Asociación Arariwa su nombre es Credi Yapa, esta línea de crédito es otorgado a los prestatarios con buen historial crediticio.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de leche, azúcar entre otros.
Al momento de tomar la foto la socia se volteo.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "KIMOYGANAKERA MAGANIROIGI" communal bank.  The bank is loacted in Echarate District, La Convención Province and Cusco Department.
The member's name is Blanca.  She is 42-years old, has two children and lives with her partner.  She divides her time between her daily chores and running her grocery store.  In her store, she sells different types of products like rice, sugar, milk and other items.  Blanca has run her business for quite some time, and it is going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into it each day.  She wants to keep working to be able to keep helping her family.  This loan is part of one of the Asociación Arariwa lines of credit called "Credi Yapa."  This line of credit is granted to borrowers with good credit history. 
Blanca is requesting this loan to purchase milk, sugar and other items. 
In the above photograph, Blanca turned just as the photo was being taken. 
Blanca feels grateful for the loan she is being granted, and she promises to comply with her established repayment plan.

loans.use: to purchase milk, sugar and other items.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 31 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past seven years, Betty has been working hard to manage her mini hotel, which sells cooked food. 

To help expand her business, Betty has requested a loan of 5,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy food items for the hotel, and will help Betty to generate greater profits and increase her standard of living. Betty hopes that in the future, she will be able to expand the business. 

Betty is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Betty who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy food items for the hotel, which sells cooked food

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 68-year-old man. He has 7 children with ages ranging from 16 to 29 years. He describes himself to be focused. 

John operates a retail store where he sells farming tools; he has been involved in this business for nine years. His business is located in an urban area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of customers. 

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of farming tools

This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His business goal is to be excelling within five years. 

He hopes that in the future, his life and that of his family will be different.   

He will use some of the anticipated profits from the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: buy more stock of farming tools

loans.name: Clemensio

texts.en: Clemensio is a 51-year-old widowed woman living in Kasese, Uganda. She has three children, all of whom go to school. She has been a food vendor for 14 years and also does farming for additional income. Her food-vending business is located in the market. Clemensio intends to use the loan to buy avocados, eggplants, and tomatoes for selling. Despite being challenged by price fluctuations and perishability of her products, Clemensio has a vision of educating her children to a level of self sustainability.

loans.use: to buy avocados, eggplant, and tomatoes for selling.

loans.name: Adamu

texts.en: Adamu remembers feeling depressed as a result of a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now Adamu, like all Babban Gona members, can earn up to $2,000/hectare this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Adamu is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 35 bags per hectare this season.  When asked about his future ambitions, Adamu said; “In five years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community.”  With this loan, Adamu is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high quality inputs

loans.name: Ashiru

texts.en: Ashiru is a 42-year-old farmer from Arewa Gwanki.  As a Babban Gona member, Ashiru is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Ashiru can earn up to $2,000/hectare this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Ashiru is ambitious and is aiming to reap 120 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Ashiru said, “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children Mubarak, Muhammadu and Abubakar, and in five years, I want to make more money for myself and my family”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high quality inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for clean cooking energy from Liquefied Petroleum Gas

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia, aged 18, is a hard-working woman who is single and has no children. She lives in the town of Gaba in the Kampala south region of Uganda. For the past three years, Sofia has been working hard to manage her poultry business which rears chickens. 

To help expand her business, Sofia has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy poultry feed and more chicks. This will help Sofia to generate greater profits and pay her school fees. Sofia hopes that in the future she will be able to own a big poultry farm. 

Sofia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed and more chicks

loans.name: Chuluunbat

texts.en: Mr. Chuluunbat, 51 years old, lives with his wife in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. He has been working as an engineer at a steel factory since 2009. His wife works at a private company. They have two sons, both of whom live in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to buy potato seeds.
